items.title: Bounty #3 Top-up Request
items.content:
## Overview

[Bounty #3](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/bounty/3) aims to provide a signing solution to bridge the dApps and mobile wallets, which using Beacon Network as a decentralized peer-to-peer network of nodes based on the matrix protocol, with trustless and encrypted message relaying.

The bounty includes the integration with Beacon SDK with Substrate-based Network, and the integration with Wallet in both iOS and Android. Overall the bounty is completed by the Beacon team, Fearless Wallet team, and Nova Wallet by June 2022.

The bounty includes relatively more work which could be split into different stages. In order to cover the financial risk for the development team, we decide to split the distribution of the bounty into 2 parts. The first part is distributed(on [Subscan](https://kusama.subscan.io/account/FC4tZgWUDpg1AK5uoY7Z9bTaUanemyipoG7Tk8W9YXpxvZ6)) in November 2021 and rest of KSM is hold in a multi-sig wallet on KSM: FC4tZgWUDpg1AK5uoY7Z9bTaUanemyipoG7Tk8W9YXpxvZ6. In June 2022, the rest of the bounty is completed, but the remaining KSM in the bounty can't cover the cost because the KSM price drops in 2022.

As the curator of the bounty, hereby I kindly ask the council to approve the request to top up 1543.17 KSM into the bounty according to the calculation.  

![Time Spent Table](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hanwencheng/Substrate-Mobile-Injector/main/res/TimeSpent.png)

## Reviews

For the detail of the review of bounty 3 please refer to: 
* [Review of Part 1 on 2021 October - Beacon](https://github.com/hanwencheng/Substrate-Mobile-Injector/blob/main/Submission/202110Beacon_Review.md)
* [Review of Part 1 on 2021 October - Fearless Wallet](https://github.com/hanwencheng/Substrate-Mobile-Injector/blob/main/Submission/202110Fearless_Submission_Review.md)
* [Review of Part 2 on 2022 June](https://github.com/hanwencheng/Substrate-Mobile-Injector/blob/main/Submission/202206Review.md)

## Bounty Distribution Recap

The reward of the bounty is paid in two parts due to the size of the work being big which may introduce financial risk to the teams if we only distribute the reward by the completion of the bounty. 

The first part is summarized in: https://github.com/hanwencheng/Substrate-Mobile-Injector/tree/main/Submission and is distributed by the multi-sig account FC4tZgWUDpg1AK5uoY7Z9bTaUanemyipoG7Tk8W9YXpxvZ6 with 394.328 KSM, the rest KSM reserved for part2 is 694.552 KSM.

The discussion is followed on [Polkassembly](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/bounty/3#75f2df36-575c-4a1e-973d-426fc01542b1)
![First Part Comment](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hanwencheng/Substrate-Mobile-Injector/main/res/firstPart.png)

The multi-sig wallet is currently handled by 4 accounts for transparency, two from me, one from Pascal of the Beacon team, and one from Anton of the Fearless/Nova team.

To be noticed here. Anton was a team member of the Fearless Wallet team and during the development, he switched his role to only the present Nova team due to the reconstruction of the companies. Anton's role in the multi-sig is not changed as he consistently worked for the bounty and provided useful insights for both teams. This is under the agreement of both the Nova and the Fearless Wallet team, and does not introduce any conflict into the reward distribution.

## Refill KSM 

Due to the volatility of KSM(The KSM price is 368 USD when we distribute the first part of the bounty, now 61.351 USD), we need to add more KSM into the bounty in order to cover the cost of the second part of the bounty.

According to the calculation, we still need 1543.17 KSM.

The KSM will first send to the multi-sig account FC4tZgWUDpg1AK5uoY7Z9bTaUanemyipoG7Tk8W9YXpxvZ6, which is also the original beneficiary of bounty #3. and be further distributed to:
* Beacon team (Paper AG): G4bxLcMawBgsCt3Qj1khSyS1MxorfyHbUXrFyjQ6zySbTrs
* Nova Foundation: H3cSNjAW86NfTecufGPhxutea8KrEcZdPa4XgVKfhTMugej
* SORAMITSU(Fearless Wallet): FyLYnuNoMAVkz1VZMMGZFHDPghQQm1916fCon1CqNt2aXbX

### Future Plan

Currently, the adoption of Beacon Protocol in Polkadot Ecosystem is strongly dependent on the decision if dApps want to integrate Beacon SDK. We find a better way to gain adoption is to integrate the Beacon SDK in the Polkadot.js extension as almost every dApp supports Polkadot.js/extension to connect the wallet. It is also beneficial for dApps because they do not need to extra effort to integrate with Beacon.

So there is some extra work to do on Polkadot.js/extension, the plan is detailed in the Github issue [here](https://github.com/polkadot-js/extension/issues/989)

The beacon team will work closely with Polkadot.js/extension team to make this happen, and apply for a new bounty when it is necessary.

### Contact Information
* Curator: Hanwen Cheng hanwen@litentry.com
* Beacon Network: Pascal p.brun@papers.ch 
* Nova Wallet: anton@novawallet.io
* Fearless Wallet: petrov@soramitsu.co.jp

items.title: ONE-T Web Insights proposal
items.content:
**ONE-T Web Insights proposal**

We believe that everyone can make better decisions by the way they explore and visualize data.

From this proposal **we aim to build ONE-T a web place, where people could visualize reports without limits**, easily digestible and simply accessible for anyone interested on this topic - **Validators and Kusama network performance**.

With this proposal we plan to bring *All* the text message insights sent by ONE-T bot to the web. From simple network status dashboards, to a list of validators with several para-validator key data points, real-time charts, as well as backend service that aggregates on-chain data from the *backing subsystem parachains protocol* and build *RESTful and WebSocket APIs* to create a seamless user experience.

This proposal also aims to cover ongoing maintenance and operational costs of ONE-T. 

![](https://i.imgur.com/kjMU0ND.jpg)

Alpha Prototype: [apps.turboflakes.io](https://apps.turboflakes.io/#/one-t/kusama/parachains/overview)

---

ONE-T is generating reports daily since April 2022. These reports are currently only available on matrix and at the time of writing, for Kusama and Polkadot combined, ONE-T gathered over the past three months **more than 170 members** on both public rooms. There are **more than 250 validator report subscriptions active** and is sending on average more than **600 reports a day** to subscribers.

The full proposal with a detailed description and costs can be found here: [https://hackmd.io/@turboflakes/BJ2i1pz3q](https://hackmd.io/@turboflakes/BJ2i1pz3q).

Any feedback is welcome.

Please review our [full proposal](https://hackmd.io/@turboflakes/BJ2i1pz3q).

items.title: Proposal for roll-out of Kusama Decentralization Analytics
items.content:
Hello Community,

Kusama, and generally speaking Substrate built block-chains have tremendous potential to deliver decentralized computing, however depending on how they are deployed and operated by the community the resulting system can be more or less centralized/decentralized.

Polkawatch is an analytic tool designed to measure effective decentralization of Polkadot/Substrate’s Validation process.

This proposal aims to roll-out Polkawatch for Kusama.

Our [detailed proposal can be found here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1f7ZWZ0W6Njp5r3qnEVnh4vulBGDBHrQ7Fgzmpqazrl4/edit?usp=sharing).

items.title: SNI Hackathon with Kenya Wildlife Trust: Treasury Proposal
items.content:
Overview
--------

**The Sovereign Nature Initiative**

[Sovereign Nature Initiative](https://sovereignnature.com/) (SNI) is a non-profit foundation that has brought together multiple partners and engineers from the Kusama ecosystem including [Kodadot](https://nft.kodadot.xyz/), [Unique Network](https://unique.network), [Kilt Protocol](https://kilt.io), [Momentum](https://odyssey.org/explore-momentum), and [Ocean Protocol](https://oceanprotocol.com/), to support the building of Web3 capacities for wildlife conservancies and other NGOs working on restoring and protecting biodiverse ecosystems.

SNI's KWT Hackathon is an online event for crowdsourcing solutions for wild-life identification with computer-vision techniques and onboarding these identities on web3 data and ssi protocols, as well as presenting these identities in different ways in the metaverse. This effort has a major impact on conservation, which currently disposes of manual techniques, taking up to 6 months to process, resulting in siloed physical profiles.

**Venue:** Odyssey Momentum online Hackathon space: sni.odyssey.org

**Hackathon Dates:** October the  7th until November the 6th

**Winners Announcement:** Tuesday the 7th of November

Candidates should apply before the 12th of September 2022 by completing [this form.](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd22MYldgFgyxj0HX5CaIq7CIAgzs8y_6gDhnM4gaupipMrjw/viewform?usp=sf_link) 

We will let applicants know if they are invited or not by the 16th of September 2022. 

**Beneficiary address:**
G2bC9gtyHBkxmg65nZiZ7pbrV7PMLNXUTwr6dqMUk8KDxXG

**Submitter address:**
G2bC9gtyHBkxmg65nZiZ7pbrV7PMLNXUTwr6dqMUk8KDxXG

Community Spend & Deliverables
------------------------------

The pledges we are seeking from the Council will provide prizes to enhance the reach and impact of these project -- 320 KSM in prizes for the winners of the contests, which will encourage them to continue building their DApps to full fruition after the Hackathon for the benefit of KWT and other conservancies around the world dealing with similar challenges (see description below).

### Amount to spend from the community pool

**Total Ask: 320 KSM**

**Distribution:**

-   80 KSM to the first 2 Winners (1 winner per challenge)

-   48 KSM to the first 2 Runners-up (1 runners-up per challenge)

-   60 KSM to be equally divided amongst the remaining teams

The Jury will be composed of representatives of KWT, SNI, and 2 experts from the field of technology and conservation. The Jury will select 4 winners to which it will distribute such an amount. In its decision, the Jury will be looking for novelty, ease of implementation with existing technologies, the degree of impact and efficiency the solution brings to the conservancies' operations, and other relevant factors such as cost of implementation etc.

Introduction to the KWT Hackathon, the Challenges & Ecosystem Growth opportunities

The Web3 for nature restoration and conservation space is growing exponentially, with Hackathons, grants, and investments flooding into this emerging ecosystem. The aim of this Web3 movement is to bring forward the development of tools and token economic models that could support NGOs and other wildlife conservation organizations to find alternative solutions to finance and manage their vital work of protecting and restoring wildlife ecosystems.

This space, loosely defined often as ReFi, Regen Community, or Web3 for Nature is currently led by Ethereum, Polygon, and by the work of Regen.Network which is part of the Cosmos ecosystem.

Sovereign Nature Initiative is recognized as a leading node in such an ecosystem and together with strategic partners such as Kilt Protocol, KodaDOT, Bitgreen, Momentum, and Unique.Network is trying to advocate for the use of the Kusama ecosystem as the "go-to" chain for environmental projects due to its recognized lowest carbon footprint in the market, and its federated framework for governance and decision-making, which are vital features for conservancies and other land stewards. 

To foster innovation in the ecosystem that is both beneficial for the network and builds capacity for nature stewards working in the field, SNI hosts online Hackathons and [Incubators](https://sovereignnature.com/programs/germinators-program) in partnership with conservancies globally.

Building on the success of our latest [competition](https://sovereignnature.com/winter-2022-hackathon-challenge) supported by the [Treasury](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/motion/425), and our recent [May 2022 Experimental Zone](https://sovereignnature.com/tpost/52pojp8lo1-reflections-on-experimental-zone-1) in Amsterdam, in October-November this year we will again be inviting the most talented Web3 teams from around the world to build tech in service to the health and balance of life on our planet.

In this iteration, we are partnering with the [Kenya Wildlife Trust](https://www.kenyawildlifetrust.org/) (KWT), an NGO committed to the protection and conservation of predators and their ecology, situated in the Maasai Mara National park in southwestern Kenya.

KWT, aware of the potential of emerging decentralized technologies, has identified two specific problems they invite teams to tackle:

-   The identification of lions through computer vision models

-   Predators and farmers' conflict management through spatio-temporal prediction modeling and other conflict mitigation approaches

Improving the lions' Identification process and ID management

A significant portion of KWT's resources is spent on the identification of predators in the Maasai Mara ecosystem. These identifications allow staff to monitor the population and  create model-density estimates and distribution trends, data which are essential for conservation. Due to their physical characteristics, individual lions are more challenging to identify than other predators and the images are painstakingly screened and processed by three employees.

This challenge is a fantastic opportunity to develop the capabilities of protocols and teams working on verifiable credentials such as our partners at Kilt Protocol.

### Predators and farmers' conflict mitigation

The survival of predators in a mixed-use landscape like the Maasai Mara depends upon the goodwill of people to coexist with other non-human and undomesticated life. In the Maasai Mara ecosystem, farmers and wildlife live in close proximity, and predators often prey on cattle. Successful measures have been taken to build better protection and deterrent mechanisms. Still, KWT knows that more can be done to create truly resilient means to support cohabitation, which considers both the socio-economical context and the everyday life of farmers' communities. We, therefore, invite teams to harness their creativity, skills, and expertise toward building tools that can serve as facilitators of a new symbiotic relationship between human communities and predators.

Ideas might include, but should not be limited to, providing the technological and economic tools for communities to safely cohabit with predators, and creating the conditions for farmers to understand the importance of predators, and participate in the value predators generate by regulating the complex dynamics of the savanna ecosystem.

This is a wonderful opportunity for protocols and teams working on data markets and IoT to validate and expand the use cases of their technology. For example, machine learning can be done using Ocean Protocol Compute-To-Data service which will allow us to hide lion tracking data from the public while opening it to data processing and prediction modeling.

### Target Group

Ideal participants are labs, startups, collectives, or companies with a heart for conservation, an ambition to build life-sustaining systems, and who are well versed in some or all of the following technology stack:

-   Web3 - wildlife and biodiversity data oracles.

-   Token Engineering - crypto native models for conservancies funds distribution.

-   Spatio-temporal prediction modeling - wildlife mobility predictions and human-wildlife conflict mitigation.

-   Citizen Science - applications for wildlife tracking and identification.

-   Computer Vision models for wild animals recognition, identification, and tracking.

Previous experience working on similar conservation projects is desired but not required.

**Maximum Team Size: 8 members**

Our intention is to have at least half of the participants based in the African continent. We foresee this being an excellent opportunity for Kusama to grow its ecosystem in the East-African region, which is currently dominated by other protocols and their respective supporting communities.

**Open Source**

Nature doesn't care about ownership. In the spirit of open collaboration, all software developed during the Hackathon should be licensed under Open Source license.

items.title: Subscan | Infrastructure Costs of Subscan for Kusama Network
items.content:
> This is a follow up proposal to what we submitted before:

> [#94 Cloudflare Enterprise Plan for Subscan from January 2022 to April 2022](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/treasury/94)

> [#95 The Infrastructure Costs of Subscan for Polkadot Network from Sep 2021 to Dec 2021](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/treasury/95)

This proposal is used to pay the infrastructure costs of the Polkadot network and its testnets. The payment involved in this proposal does not include any software development, human resources, etc. 

Previously, every infrastructure cost of Subscan was applied by submitting treasury proposals separately. The application time was asynchronous and the process was complicated, which is easy to cause some confusion to users, and it is inconvenient to clearly obtain the monthly cost. Therefore , this application will count all unpaid infrastructure costs of the polkadot network before June 30, 2022, including:

- GCP: January 1st - June 30th
- Datadog: January 1st - June 30th
- Cloudflare: April 15th - June 30th

In the future, the billing time of all bills will be completely unified, which is more convenient for community management and supervision.

This time, we plan to apply for **13,091 USD in Kusama**, the amount of KSM will be converted based on the **EMA7 price** on the day of the official submission.  

- 2022-07-27 10:59:00 (+UTC), Block #13743315
- KSM EMA7 Price ( USD ): 60.151;
- Number of KSM: 217.632
>https://kusama.subscan.io/tools/price_converter?value=13091&type=time&from=USD&to=KSM&time=1658919600

**Billing details can be read [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wXSELzfmNH1CP9JbI5Nq1wu8H83vnxJJ22TEjkF2Wgg/edit?usp=sharing).**

items.title: The Kusamarian 6 Month Maintenance Proposal
items.content:
Original Discusion **[here](https://kusama.subsquare.io/post/3)**.

During the **Q1** of 2022 **Chrawnna Corp.** delivered 5 weekday Dotsama-focused news videos every week and established a prototype of **WagMedia** — a Discord-based reward delivery system focused on connecting those who want to Share, Create, and Distribute the Story of Dotsama with sources of funding.

In **Q2**, The Kusamarian brand was created, gaining over 1000 followers on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/TheKusamarian), aiming to deliver even more frequent content with contributions from some of the strongest participants in WagMedia, growing the production team to 8. The team is fantastically agile, able to push out high quality and up to date content, interviews, or Special Series such as the 19 video **[Polkadot Decoded Reloaded](https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLtyd7v_I7PGlgPCXuIs55wwnbk594Kecw)** event. All content from the quarter can be found [here](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqNw3CEyOD-bjjYYaxVyG3Q/) and our **Proof of Work** including all research, rough work, references, SEO, and detailed [Spending Report](https://flying-wolf-8be.notion.site/Production-Funds-de4afb47625d48a9b4a5f0e74d074dff) is publicly available [here](https://flying-wolf-8be.notion.site/Q2-Content-Report-40b59b62222c46a6ac738359b8704b05).

Several Treasuries were also plugged into** WagMedia **over the last 2 quarters including Polka Häus, Jam’s Cave, Lucky Friday, Astar/Shiden, RMRK, Crust, Moonbeam/Moonriver, Solarbeam, Scytale Ventures, Bifrost, and the Kusama Treasury via Bounty #12. More are on the way!

In **Q3 & 4 **we are requesting to spend the same rates for content production with a slightly reduced output adjusted to market sentiment. We're also reintroducing a Tutorial show for when attention returns to the ecosystem as well as mastering our catalogue of [60+ interviews](https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLtyd7v_I7PGkq7KUe3ep3lFLgKG97Z2AO) for distribution on popular podcast platforms. For each quarter we are requesting to spend aprox. 14% less than **Q2**

We are, however, for the first time additionally proposing to spend 14% of the requested **8002.8 KSM** on further developing **WagMedia** which endeavours to handle all content-focused tip and spending proposals previously put at the foot of the council. Goals over the next 2 quarters include, expanding our peer-reviewed translation and non-anglo community units, opening our Marketing department, and further decentralizing award distribution with the development of our bot, **The Concierge**. A proposal to top up **Bounty #12** to handle the Spend Proposal and Translation features (not part of the original curatorship) will follow [shortly](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ZA2kmLxJyFbF5Xwa7dxdrK6b6F8Z8UbUiMoU-lBoMRQ/edit#).

For now please dive into T[he Kusamarian 6 Month Maintenance Proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_C34F07_LgY6DLgiXiLxbkMY_YH53if6esNhxXXYDG4/edit?usp=sharing) where you can meet our team, see what they propose to spend, and what they'll continue to build.

Thank you for supporting **Chrawnna Corp.** from a small tutorial youtube channel to what is today. We work every day to create top quality content in line with Token Holder interests with **The Kusamarian**. And with **WagMedia** we put the treasury to work by connecting it to eager content creators Decentralizing the Story of Dotsama within a productive and supportive community.

Your comments, questions, and constructive suggestions are most welcome.

items.title: RadiumBlock Public Endpoint Service for Kusama (Q2 2022)
items.content:
RadiumBlock intends to be a Web3 infrastructure provider for DotSama. Since most clients that need to connect to the Kusama network rely on RPC nodes to interact with the network, we believe variety and high quality in the RPC service is important for a healthy decentralized network. 

This proposal is to cover the ongoing costs(Q2 2022) for the running of our low latency, geo-distributed, high performance, scalable, and reliable public infrastructure for Kusama.

Our [detailed proposal can be read here.](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1i0qCZTA9tL1zh7Z-cO_-aPaDJp88dyYy/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=114172945417100820622&rtpof=true&sd=true)

items.title: Encointer Growth Treasury Proposal
items.content:
Encointer seeks for financing of its planned activities for the remaining time of its current common-good parachain lease, split into two proposals. The current proposal shall cover the funding until the end of September 2022. 

The amount of the proposed treasury spend is **CHF 340’000 = USD 350'892 = KSM 6271.63**.
*using [EMA50](https://kusama.subscan.io/tools/charts?type=price) and today's bid price for CHF*

Encointer has onboarded as a common good parachain on Kusama on Jan 9th 2022. In May 2022, a first real community in Zurich was launched and has steadily grown to 130 users within 40 days doing almost 800 transactions in community currency. More communities are in preparation currently

The main focus of Encointer is currently:

* to grow its Zurich community in order to prove the viability of its protocol and implementation as well as its economics with a pioneer community.
* to onboard new communities around the world, especially in less developed regions in order to follow its vision.
* to integrate with other parachains in the DotSama ecosystem for sybil-defense and one-person-one-vote democracy.

So far, Encointer was able to finance its past activities mostly thanks to the appreciation of the DOT and KSM tokens it received as web3 or DOT/KSM treasury grants. The association was also able to collect private donations and significant amounts of work were provided pro bono. Encointer’s financial strategy has been to keep around 70% of its capital in DOT and KSM which proved to be a good strategy so far, as our detailed numbers will show below. Due to recent market corrections, however, the runway of Encointer has dramatically decreased and Encointer can currently only maintain its current activity (development, operation, marketing, community building) for ~2 more months.  As a common-good, Encointer has no way to promise any return on investment, so the project relies on grants and donations.

See our [Proposal with full details](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1eTyZGCTCzo7ZGonVtAmJmc5QYYI0qYHab6z8w56B_F0/edit?usp=sharing)

items.title: ParisDotComm 2022 event support - a complete Polkadot event during ETHCC - Paris
items.content:
### Summary

This proposal is a request to support the financing of the ParisDotComm.

What is ParisDotComm?

A 3 days of conference and workshops sessions organized by some of the leading projects of the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystems.
Offering an inclusive space to meet, greet, talk and exchange thoughts, and perhaps kick off the next interesting collaboration.

**ParisDotComm** will take place on **July 19-21th** in the Arab World Institute in Paris.
The main goal of the Event is to gather the Dotsama Ecosystem during the ETHCC 2022, to learn about the progress of Parachains and create new cooperation efforts between parachains and the blockchain world.

The event is led by a strong team: Elisabeth (Amsterdot - HydraDX), Benjamin (Astar Ambassador and DevOps), David (Polkadot Head Ambassador - logion), supported by experienced Parity teams. More than 10 partners are already involved.

Together with the community, in a wonderful place, let's make this event a beautiful opportunity to exchange and open up to the blockchain world.

More information about the proposal are available here:

[Our proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1bUoeKAydgDSHcnMNF03aBaJLNIpZnw6AQinES2xvvnQ/edit?usp=sharing)

Or in copy/paste mode :

items.content:
We successfully organized the Polkadot Decoded 2022, New Delhi Edition with a gathering of over 100 people. Apart from showcasing online streams the event also included speakers who discussed the basics of Polkadot and Kusama.

We have documented the whole event in this document. We have made sure to include all the photos and other social media posts in this link.

[Event Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1B0bBRf6isxfp71e9cJYtDW5dCSgGyd34tiBwMQcSQhA/edit?usp=sharing)

items.title: BrightTreasury - further integration with Polkassembly
items.content:
**This proposal was added through BrightTreasury. For more info & discussion, check [BrightTreasury](https://treasury.bright.dev/proposals/179?networkId=kusama)**

## About the project

The goal of the proposal is to fund development of further integration of BrightTreasury with Polkassembly. It would cover sharing the proposal Ideas to Polkassembly as a discussion as well as cross-posting of comments added via BrightTreasury & Polkassembly. This way any discussion about potential proposals could be held between users using their app of preference. As we focus on users who are less fluent in the Polkadot governance and community customs, it would allow them to gather feedback from more advanced users, who might be more inclined to use Polkassembly.

Project Link : https://treasury.bright.dev

BrightTreasury is a standalone web application along with a PWA representation that allows performing basic actions on the Treasury module of Polkadot and Kusama Substrate networks (with a potential to support any Substrate-based network with Treasury module). It allows a more intuitive and lightweight flow of submitting proposals as well as an overview of the Treasury related actions.

Our focus is on the regular user’s actions rather than the council perspective for this first release. We want to attract more professionals who could contribute to the community with their ideas and skills but at the same time may not be as fluent in blockchain customs and terminology.

## Milestones

* Ideas Polkassembly integration
* Comments Polkassembly integration
* "Likes" in BrightTreasury + UX Improvements

[See more...](https://treasury.bright.dev/proposals/179/milestones?networkId=kusama)

items.title: Kusama Treasury Proposal Fearless Wallet: Wallet UI/UX Update, NFTs, Democracy, Cross-chain teleports (XCM integration), Staking pools, dApp signer
items.content:
This is a treasury proposal whose proposer address (FyLYnuNoMAVkz1VZMMGZFHDPghQQm1916fCon1CqNt2aXbX) is shown in on-chain info below.

**Fearless Wallet Proposal**: [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ex7ew2P7w2nUQ_ZECoeGlsCMORGOR6YdwD5YP1JS__0/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ex7ew2P7w2nUQ_ZECoeGlsCMORGOR6YdwD5YP1JS__0/edit?usp=sharing)

![](https://i.postimg.cc/9FMfrj9P/Proposal-background.jpg)

**Context of the proposal**

[Fearless Wallet ](https://fearlesswallet.io/)is:

- A native **open source mobile app** for [iOS/](https://apps.apple.com/ru/app/fearless-wallet/id1537251089?l=en)[Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=jp.co.soramitsu.fearless) 
- A native **open source library** for Substrate [iOS](https://github.com/soramitsu/fearless-utils-iOS)/[Android](https://github.com/soramitsu/fearless-utils-Android)
- **Non-custodial** and **decentralized**, communicating directly with blockchain nodes
- An app with **superior UX/UI, performance and security**
- Used by **130 000+ people around the world** (based on AppStore and Google Play data)
- **50 000+ active users (MAU)** based on recent App Markets data 
- **An important source of traffic, with 1 mln+** daily requests to Kusama and Polkadot, and other parachains (based on OnFinality nodes)
- **Fully funded and supported by** [Kusama Treasury](https://kusama.network/), developed by [SORAMITSU](https://soramitsu.co.jp/)


**This proposal focuses** on the implementation of:

- **A UI/UX update of the main Wallet screens and flows**: The wallet’s current version could struggle to keep up with the breakneck pace of recent and upcoming initiatives and innovations of the ecosystem. The new wallet design will solve this set of issues and challenges, such as supporting multiple assets from hundreds of parachains, along with the possibility to exchange tokens between networks, work with NFTs and perform swaps within the wallet interface. 
- **NFT integration (Stage 1)**: Non-fungible token support is a feature that has  great community demand. In terms of the Stage #1 we’re going to implement some basic flows such as integrating a list of NFTs and Collections, along with NFT details and transfers. This implementation will be made for Statemine and Kusama (RMRK) NFT. In the future other NFT products of the Ecosystem can be supported through other proposals.
- **Democracy feature integration (Stage 1)**: Democracy and governance systems are an important Dotsama advantage. The most valuable and demanded Democracy functions are Referenda flows and the ability to submit Proposals and vote for them. Stage #1 of integration will address these functions, and will also provide off-chain integration with Polkassembly and Subsquare platforms, to give users an opportunity to participate in an initiative’s preliminary discussions on the Polkassembly platform. All proposed integrations will be compatible with the upcoming Governance v2.0 update.
- **XCM cross-chain teleports support**: Interoperability is one of the Dotsama ecosystem’s main benefits. The XCM message format allows assets to be moved between relay chains and parachains (and vice versa), as well as between various parachains. It provides the Ecosystem amazing flexibility, liquidity mobility, and high performance. As a part of this proposal we are going to implement XCM teleports between relay chains (Polkadot/Kusama) and parachains.
- **Staking update on Polkadot/Kusama. Nomination pools.** Staking is a crucial functionality on blockchains that have PoS(DPoS/NPoS) consensus algorithms. In fact, community members are eager to make their contribution to system stability, safety, and decentralization by staking their assets. Nomination pools functionality is a cutting edge update of the staking function set. Therefore, our team has decided to add it to the scope of work, and is certain this innovative development will become a new trend in the Dotsama ecosystem.

- **dApp connector/signer**. The feature will work together with the Fearless Web extension application. The Web extension app has the role of a middleware service that provides some logic and necessary APIs to communicate between Mobile clients (Fearless Wallet Android/iOS Apps) and the Polkadot JS Extension protocol. It will allow users to: 

1.  Establish and maintain a connection with a dApp
2.  Verify dApp generated transactions via the Mobile App without the need to export their user accounts to Web browsers


**Submission details**

All details are available in the [proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ex7ew2P7w2nUQ_ZECoeGlsCMORGOR6YdwD5YP1JS__0/edit?usp=sharing).


**The amount requested for the first submission is  $ 318 500.**

The amount will be recalculated according to the 7 day average rate, using the high and low of the week on Coingecko, at the day of on-chain action after the discussion process ends.


**The 1st milestone  includes:**

- New Wallet UI/UX 
- Nomination pools 
- Half of infrastructural costs


**Previous grant completion report and final demo**

- [Link to the report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NMYMsKBDFiRGWB5I05v8aNrM3pq6qKrXQcfhhs4guR4/edit?usp=sharing)
- [Demo #8, April 12th, 2022](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PbBzEUkUWFo)

items.title: Building the Kusamaverse - Milestone 2
items.content:
**Building milestone 2 of the Kusamaverse**

- Governance - Polkassembly visualised and interactive + grant programs
- Parachains - Auctions, crowdloans and real-life data visualised and interactive + parachain subspaces
- Wallet integration - Talisman, Fearless, Nova and SubWallet.
- Staking - User interface upgrade
- Hackathon arena - real online collaborative hack experience + on-chain bounties
- User activity timeline - tailor made ‘activity-update-timeline’ for users
- NFT - display your NFTs in profile and spaces in Kusamaverse
- Guided tour - comfortable on-boarding for new people + ‘fly with me’ feature
- Gatherings on mobile

![](https://odyssey.org/_Resources/Persistent/3/8/7/8/3878ec74f2aa0bccb6d157d66aa24bf784ee6d44/FSeBAC2X0AMk291-1657x969.webp)

**About the Kusamaverse**

The Kusamaverse is a real-time and persistent 3D home for the Kusama ecosystem. Where the Kusama community can gather, engage into on-chain and off-chain activities, tailored to collective value creation, and can build their own social network economy. Where activities like staking, parachain auctions, as well as gatherings, hackathons are directly accessible as a shared experience in the metaverse. Enabling a new way for users to navigate, connect and contribute to and benefit from the Kusama ecosystem.

**Where we are now**

[The 101 on Kusamaverse and Momentum](https://twitter.com/MomentumXYZ/status/1526796026136477696)

[Open-source repo of Momentum](https://github.com/momentum-xyz)

[Kusamaverse](https://kusama.momentum.xyz/login) is now live, in its first, very basic, form.

Community Launch on May 24, 15.00 CET.


**Proposal milestone 2**

Please find the full proposal [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1R0Mk6QTiaproiierkn4YoEcCYlZpbL9hpYzoQqTaL80/edit), looking forward to questions and feedback!

items.title: Subsquid - Public data indexing Infrastructure for Kusama (Q2 2022)
items.content:
## Ongoing costs for the running of high performance, scalable, and reliable data indexing infrastructure for most of the DotSama ecosystem (and growing).

Archives are an important piece of DotSama data infrastructure provided by Subsquid. They provide access to on-chain data in GraphQL format for all major parachains on Kusama and Polkadot, with more chains added as the ecosystem grows. They are being used as a data source for Squids and for efficient data exploration and ad-hoc queries. An up-to-date list of Archives is kept in a public Archive Registry
All archives can be accessed and queried via an web intuitive GraphiQL interface and are often used as developer friendly replacement of a block explorer.

Over the last 3 months (March, April, May 2022) we've provided a free public data indexing service for ~35 Substrate blockchains (some archives have been dismissed, new ones have been added), so that everyone interested in the projects can publicly access indexed data on Substrate Events, Extrinsics, Storage Items and EVM logs.

Between 2022-03-20 (when tracking has started) and 2022-05-06 Subsquid’s Archive infrastructure has collectively:

- Served a total of 1,213,705,478 (1.2 billion) queries
- The highest daily total was 394,214,930 responses in a single 24 hour period
- Our 7 day average at the end of this period is over 25 million responses each day.
- Kusama and Polkadot chains represent a very important share of the demanded data, with 10 and 2.8 million queries per week, respectively

![](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vTM5hIviY0x_1YVeOD0QEw8uPvPHmFKNcAQrEwCQGSF7JuYAZuUCYo9dXrIfRnCQqVVH5tIMzCb1jjC/pubchart?oid=1449674255&format=image)

This proposal includes the combined costs for running Archives for Kusama and its Parachains, which amounts to a total of  USD $9,771.07 - [raw data is here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1RkNQ6-10u_nmmNy2Nkwi-i9EDXv6VwwLJw4DdJVx1pQ/).

[Full text of the proposal can be found here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/e/2PACX-1vRtyrXYpKdTbv0TcKuqSO_LR2OU4KiqWjUsHaRftNtu7KtpGP1_Q6gXbGzZupPRQhfnD2z5UuhCIOmv/pub)

Thank you for your consideration, Subsquid.io

[Website](https://subsquid.io/) [Twitter](https://twitter.com/subsquid) [Email](mailto:social@subsquid.io) [Github](https://github.com/subsquid/)

items.title: RIO DE JANEIRO BRAZIL - POLKADOT DECODED LAUNCH EVENT IN RIO
items.content:
> Proponent:  ecardo5o /  KSM Account: EkQWFRUHmSt8qCwmgYv8TNSaFu1Xo5DaDAHBZbZZFxXMwDr
Contact: Eduardo Cardoso [ecardoso@pointille.com.br ] / Discord: _ecardo5o#3065
Date: 29 June 2022
Requested KSM:  KSM:841,96  USD $46,813.00 EMA7 

Holding an edition of Polkadot Decoded in Buenos Aires this year puts Latin America definitely on the roadmap of our ecosystem.

But it also leaves a gap in our continent, which basically splits into two languages:

- Portuguese, spoken only in Brazil
- And Spanish, predominant in other countries

Because of this and also other factors (which are well detailed in the link below), we strongly believe that it is necessary to hold an event at this moment that helps to reverberate Polkadot Decoded in Brazil as well.

Analyzing this case over the last two weeks, we came to the conclusion that this event would not fit the standard of a Viewing Party.

Although we have great interest in cryptocurrencies in the country, we realized that the content presented in Polkadot Decoded is too advanced for our local audience and that it would be better to think about it in another way, taking advantage of this moment in which Polkadot Decoded is being carried out and reverberated by the All the world.

The solution would be to think of an event that better connects our small community with decision makers in the traditional financial market (since the country is very open to legislation favorable to cryptos, with large financial institutions announcing the start of their operations in the sector), journalists and opinion makers. All these audiences are currently interested in the subject but are totally unaware of the DOTSAMA ecosystem and above all its possibilities and fundamentals.

The result of this analysis is a project that does not fit well in a Viewing Party. But that we believe is the ideal for this moment. In these two weeks we talked to a lot of people and ended up assembling a highly qualified team for this mission. And we're very motivated to do something that fills that gap above with a for-all event that combines:

- Informational and Educational Content.
- Debate
- Participation of Our Local Ambassadors.
- Relationship building with the agents mentioned above (market decision makers, journalists and opinion makers).
- Reverberation in networks.
- Documentation (through the registration and subsequent publication of these lectures and debate).

We also want with this event:

- Communicate what Polkadot Decoded is.
- Talk about what people will be able to access about this 2022 edition.
- Make a Happy Hour that is in tune with the festive spirit of our culture.
- Position DOTSAMA as a protagonist in the development of WEB3, providing a technological environment focused on innovation.

The way we want to do this will really be outside the parameters of a traditional corporate event and we hope that everyone here will be able to read our Proposal, appreciate our ideas and contribute their suggestions. Despite the different format, our total cost of realization is compatible with other events presented.

We do not want and should not leave Brazil with this gap.

More Details: [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1D_MKIhzkUAUT9uKkOuFiiMKooARIT5ZAnJXMyMOJPZc/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1D_MKIhzkUAUT9uKkOuFiiMKooARIT5ZAnJXMyMOJPZc/edit?usp=sharing)

items.title: Mexican Polkadot Decoded Closing Party!! by Espacio Cripto
items.content:
**Requested KSM: **$45,095 USD for the execution of the closing party for Polkadot Decoded Mexico City. This is 988.71 KSM at a 7-day average price of $59.07 USD per KSM. Currently, there’s a big difference between the 7-day average price and the current market price. We took into account this difference to make sure we get the amount of USD we need to execute the event. See the breakdown in the payment conditions document

**Short description: **The event for Polkadot Decoded in Mexico is facing some challenges. It was announced that Mexico would host an official event for Decoded, today there are more than 170 people registered to assist in the event, and people are starting to ask why Mexico does not appear on the official Decoded Site (Examples in the document). The Mexican community AT LEAST deserves a Polkadot Level closing party on June 30. This is a proposal to maintain Polkadot’s reputation in Mexico, and execute a 500 people party in one of the coolest venues in the city, with a cost per attendee of $90 USD, one of the most efficient costs compared to other similar proposals like Korea’s kickoff party.

Here you can read the whole proposal: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_14ItHphMQnTyBShzMgQxlQ8QsuEaIpYZltoYingnsg/edit#

items.title: Proposal: Polkadot Decoded Viewing Party in Spain, June 29-30, 2022
items.content:
[Cervera](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsP0zGvvzB4RGyDYHkDdmUA), a community member who contributes to Polkadot and Kusama by creating educational videos about the ecosystem, is planning to host a viewing party for Polkadot Decoded, dedicated to the DotSama community in Spain. This networking event will be held during June 29-30, 2022, in Valencia, Spain.

Valencia is the third Spanish city with the largest number of inhabitants, and we want to give the Spanish community of Polkadot the opportunity to see and enjoy Decoded from home.

This viewing party include two full days of streaming the event in a large venue located with a capacity of up to 120 people. All accompanied by music, food and beverages, and some shows during break times.

items.title: Dotsama Adventure Presents: Deploy Chaos -- Event Experience
items.content:
![](https://i.ibb.co/KxNTtNc/DOTSAMA-Adventures.png)

The maturing of our cryptospace and the continuation of its mass adoption do not depend only on technological and economic phenomena. Also part of this equation is the development of human bonds and a social and cultural awareness of the impacts that WEB3 will have on all of us. In order to pierce this bubble that makes these topics and discussions so far from the reality of most people, the DOTSAMA Adventures project was created. 

Through its actions, meetings and seminars (all held so far only in Latin America) DOTSAMA Adventures has been bringing the academic community, investors, entrepreneurs, students and even people who have heard about cryptos but in fact still don't know what it is about.

![](https://i.ibb.co/NZ5V1Jh/Flyer-Among-the-Stars.png)

DOTSAMA Adventures is a collaborative initiative between members of the ecosystem passionate about decentralised technologies, the same that made the caravan that toured Chile - Among the Stars, inspired by the first activation movements promoted in Latin America, which were the Lima Latam Day.  The final event of this tour was broadcasted on the Polkadot en Español channel (YouTube): https://youtu.be/0qW2z_zpNF0

![](https://i.ibb.co/mbWxQ8p/Fotos-Among-the-Stars.png)

All this continuous work in the transmission of knowledge, coexistence and integration has had a great impact on our ecosystem in Latin America, bringing new stakeholders and promoting strategic links and joint action in several countries, something that had not happened until then. Today, this  initiatives involve Ambassadors in Chile, Brazil, Argentina, Peru and Colombia and the objective now is to strengthen these ties in the European Continent as well.

![](https://i.ibb.co/txVPwdM/Barcelona.png)

For this, the Group created the Spain Activation project, which will consist of the first official and face-to-face meetings of these members of the DOTSAMA community in Latin America with their peers in Europe, in addition to a program that will also involve different sectors of Spanish society - from technology, to sports professionals, through art, science, education and gastronomy.

Our objective in all these actions will be one: to democratize knowledge about the benefits of a Web3, positioning the DOTSAMA ecosystem (including its Parachains) as the main protagonists in this journey.

**DOTSAMA Adventures -  Spain Activation Proposal**:[ Proposal Spain Deploy Chaos](https://docs.google.com/document/d/165atRa67b4ioXmIShDMYAcXAyQKaGDATG9QYlG9tOB0/edit)

**Dotsama Adventures- Brief: Brief Deploy Chaos Spain** -[ DOTSAMA ADVENTURE.pdf](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-uqClTQNhbCIqtsQDnN9UeDV6vYLiXCA/view?usp=sharing)

items.title: Nova Wallet 2nd Proposal: Cold Wallets, Cross-chain transfers, Governance, Community-selected features
items.content:
**Nova Wallet 2nd Proposal: Cold Wallets, Cross-chain transfers, Governance, Community-selected features**
[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RZjS9mMlNXMWK7CoSHddwSHAV6KXAtry13YcJiu8-aQ](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RZjS9mMlNXMWK7CoSHddwSHAV6KXAtry13YcJiu8-aQ)

![](https://i.postimg.cc/MKqMq2QF/Nova-2nd-Proposal.png)

**Feature set of the proposal (see [proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RZjS9mMlNXMWK7CoSHddwSHAV6KXAtry13YcJiu8-aQ))**
- Cold Wallets integration: Watch mode, Parity Signer, Ledger
- Cross-chain transfers: Polkadot/Kusama <—> Parachains
- Governance: The first iteration of the upcoming Governance 2.0
- Community-selected features: Based on requests from the community

\
\
**Context of the proposal**
\
\
             **[Nova Wallet](https://novawallet.io/)** is one of the **most advanced mobile apps** for the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystem:


                ●    Nova supports **45** Polkadot ecosystem **networks in realtime**


                ●    **10 000+ active users** on both iOS/Android


                ●    **Multi-assets support** in Karura, Moonriver, Bifrost, Parallel, Acala, Moonbeam, Statemine, Kintsugi, Interlay, allowing to manage **74+ ecosystem tokens**


                ●    Support of **NFTs** on Statemine (**uniques**) and Kusama (**RMRK**)


                ●    Polkadot & Kusama **Crowdloans** & Contribution history


                ●    User-friendly DOT & KSM **onchain Staking** with rewards history & total rewards


                ●    **DApp browser** with Polkadot JS and MetaMask protocols support


                ●    **High quality**, **open-source**, and **community-oriented** iOS/Android apps


                ●    **Funded by Kusama Treasury**, collaborating with **over 60+ teams** in the ecosystem
\
\
\
             On December 2021, our previous Kusama Treasury proposal was [approved](https://twitter.com/NovaWalletApp/status/1468922441351188487), and in April 2022 we have successfully delivered proposed features. Please refer to Nova #11 demo for reviewing delivered features: [YouTube — Nova Wallet Demo #11 Kusama Treasury Grant Results walkthrough](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O-5OtlbvVWs)

             Our goal for **[Nova Wallet](https://novawallet.io/)** is to build and maintain high-quality, open-source, and community-oriented mobile applications which will be unbiased to any network, and provide as many features as possible to the user, without any limitations/restrictions. 

             This proposal covers the further evolution of Nova Wallet as a mobile application in the Polkadot ecosystem, **aiming to extend the feature set** of mobile applications by allowing users to **utilize Cold Wallets with powerful Nova UI**, **sending assets cross-chain between ecosystem networks**, introducing the first steps towards **user-friendly Governance on mobile devices**, and **developing features suggested by the community**.
\
\
\
**Please review the full proposal with a detailed description & costs:**
[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RZjS9mMlNXMWK7CoSHddwSHAV6KXAtry13YcJiu8-aQ](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RZjS9mMlNXMWK7CoSHddwSHAV6KXAtry13YcJiu8-aQ)

items.title: "Polkadot World" Event in Barcelona
items.content:
This proposal aims to cover organizational costs, curation and setup of the "Polkadot World" event on June 17, 18, 19, 2022, in Barcelona (Spain).

Polkadot World aims to be the first three-day face-to-face event aimed both at the Spanish community of Polkadot and Kusama Networks and to all of those who want to join the ecosystem. During those days, the community will be able to enjoy an introduction to the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystems, explanations, workshops and talks on different hot topics of the ecosystem: all accompanied by catering, live music and special guests. The objective of creating the event is to unite the entire Polkadot and Kusama communities, mobilize the Spanish community and establish ties between the community members.

As a team, we celebrate this event in order to create a space in which to provide attendees with all the necessary information and support in an understandable way for them and motivate the community to be active members of the ecosystem. Our goal is to continue organizing dynamics like this to spread the ethos of the ecosystem throughout Spain and throughout the world.

Check the full proposal [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zU1YYvXHt2jESUBDIkFYVN9Bp17_FViSRlhZXY9pu38/edit).

Original post discussion can be found [here](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1522).

Further community feedback may be found on this discussion [post](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1445) and on this [tweet](https://twitter.com/polkadot_world/status/1524037750147665922)

[Brief Polkadot World Barcelona](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1VOU4ZD3gMkjlvJCt-THtqtJXJvjA8INM/view?usp=sharing)

items.title: Polkassembly Maintainence Proposal
items.content:
Polkassembly is an integral part of polkadot and kusama governance. This submission proposes a recurring payment (quarterly) to cover maintenance, operations and human resource costs for Polkassembly, including general maintenance, runtime upgrades changes and could/infrastructure cost. Since Polkassembly supports both Kusama and Polkadot Networks, this maintenance proposal will alternate networks for submission every three months. This submission covers costs for April, May and June of 2022. We are requesting the Kusama treasury to provide funds this time. We are using a 7 days EMA due to sharp price fall of KSM.

The full proposal is available [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1r1Z71GQ8HyovvUAcdlId3_H8hMqRxdS4rz6z3u30evQ/edit?usp=sharing)

items.title: Kusama/Polkadot Network Snapshot Education and Resiliency
items.content:
.Hello Council Team:

1KVnode is a team in North America focusing on the validators ecosystem recently. We find that providing a decentralized infrastructure for the community is important and key to their recovery in a degraded situation. Having multiple mirror copies of snapshots will assist the community to increase their ability to handle the recovery time.

We are expecting to provide snapshot services in Polkadot, Kusama, and Westend. Nevertheless, we feel that Westend, while being a test-net, it plays a role in many alpha developments of various applications.

We want to help the community by providing additional instructions for new validators in several languages (English, French, Chinese, Spanish). They will be posted on various social medias. In the meanwhile, we are also looking to decentralize the snapshots service to more service providers out there than the existing ones that we know.

We welcome feedback from the community and the official team,

A copy of the detailed proposal can be found [here.](https://docs.google.com/document/d/12_NweuAvFyPyb2nWHn4ZaoPf5JPZn5XmteQg2WFjbcU/edit#heading=h.9lx3uiu2vy1q)

Sincerely,

1KVnode Team

items.title: Bright Treasury maintenance 04.2022 - 06.2022
items.content:
The goal of the proposal is to fund the Bright Treasury app maintenance costs. We have automated tests and deployment of infrastructure templates with continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD). The infrastructure as code approach lets us have an easy run and update of the environment.

Project Link : https://treasury.bright.dev Link to any documentation already published: https://github.com/bright/bright-tresury

BrightTreasury is a standalone web application along with a PWA representation that allows performing basic actions on the Treasury module of Polkadot and Kusama Substrate networks (with a potential to support any Substrate-based network with Treasury module). It allows a more intuitive and lightweight flow of submitting proposals as well as an overview of the Treasury related actions.

Our focus is on the regular user’s actions rather than the council perspective for this first release. We want to attract more professionals who could contribute to the community with their ideas and skills but at the same time may not be as fluent in blockchain customs and terminology.

Bright Inventions is a team of 70 developers, project managers, UX/UI designers and operations specialists - experts in mobile and web applications, systems integration, IOT devices and Blockchain platforms.

We believe that building a software product is about people working together in a collective way. By offering complex support – mobile and web development as well as IT consultancy we try to eliminate roadblocks towards engaging clients as partners at every step of the process.

We support startups, digital agencies as well as medium to big businesses. We cooperate with startups, accelerators and incubators. Whatever the client profile is, we always aim to establish a satisfying partnership for both sides. Since 2012 we have built software for more than 40 businesses worldwide.

The BrightTreasury team currently consists of:

Agnieszka Olszewska - Technical Lead, blockchain specialist. She is a senior backend developer with a main interest in data modeling. She started her software development career 10 years ago and from then she began discovering a lot of new technologies. Among them there are JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Postgres, Node.js, NestJS. Most recently she’s been engaged in developing blockchain based solutions with Substrate.

Alisa Kashytska - UI/UX design She is a UI/UX designer with a passion for digging deep into the product domain and understanding the user's perspective. She has worked on the design for multiple web/mobile solutions and lately has been responsible for UI redesign of Parity Building Blocks Android and web apps.

Łukasz Kuderewski - fullstack developer He is an optimist, always willing to learn new things. Mechatronics engineer who fell in love with programming. He has always been interested in a holistic approach to programming problems, which is why after working as a frontend, he is now fulfilled as a fullstack.

Robert Koprowski - fullstack developer, blockchain specialist He is an experienced and ambitious blockchain enthusiast. Graduated from the University of Edinburgh, he lived in various locations around the world to settle now in Gdańsk. Originally a Backend Developer who decided to extend his skills and become Fullstack Developer, always trying to learn something new.

Katarzyna Łukasiewicz - Project Manager She has been working with agile methods for over 10 years, both as a researcher and a practitioner. She believes in teamwork and a power of user centered mindset. With experience in leading international projects, she knows how to support and encourage timely and high quality deliveries.

Based on our 01-03.2022 Maintenance proposal (https://treasury.bright.dev/proposals/85/info?networkId=polkadot) we prepared a prediction of costs for the upcoming 3 months.

3 month Maintenance cost projection for April, May, June 2022:

- AWS app hosting prediction for 3 months	2300 $
- Self-hosted TeamCity CI server	                1000 $
- Infrastructure maintenance activities labour	5000 $
- Code maintenance activities labour	        7000 $
- Marketing & educational activities labour	1200 $

                                                     TOTAL	16,500 $

Infrastructure maintenance activities include:

- AWS logs checkup - scanning the logs and statistics checkup, performed every morning in the work days
- Incident and problem management - taking action whenever an unwanted event occurs in the infrastructure
- Infrastructure updates - checking and updating any infrastructure setup when a new version appears

Code maintenance activities include:

- Critical bug fixes (Github issue tracker) - analyzing and performing the required actions whenever a critical issue is raised in the BrightTreasury GitHub issue tracker. Action should be taken within 24hrs from raising the issue.
- PolkadotJS and stage/testing/production Substrate versions updates - updating the app to work with the newest PolkadotJS versions and automatic testing of the versions in CI
- Libraries and tools updates - performing any necessary updates of the libraries and tools used with the app

Marketing & educational activities include:

- Publishing 3 blog posts promoting Polkadot and Kusama Treasury mechanisms, BrightTreasury and Web 3.0. Articles are planned to be distributed through various platforms e.g. https://brightinventions.pl/blog https://hackernoon.com/ https://dev.to/ https://medium.com/
- YouTube tutorial presenting basic BrightTreasury features.
- Series of Twitter posts regarding BrightTreasury published via https://twitter.com/brightdevs

Payment Conditions:

Total allocation to be paid in advance for quarterly periods, based on estimations.
Any fluctuations of the period before will be added in the next one, along with proof of cost, in order to be covered.
The team will provide maintenance reports before on-chain submission of proposals to treasuries to cover the above mentioned costs.
Maintenance costs will be covered by both Kusama and Polkadot treasuries: we aim to submit quarterly proposals alternating between both treasuries, as both networks are integrated to the application.
Token rate to be calculated based on 30day average tool by Subcan on Polkadot and Kusama.

items.title: OpenSquare off-chain voting enhancement from 12.2021 to 03.2022
items.content:
Proponent: OpenSquare(ESgz7GLVW7BL5DhRgpVnxSXVwaKt4ytWcrf52TY1GQD1cEb)  
Date: 05/03/2022  
Requested Allocation: 190.63 KSM (EMA30 price of KSM on subscan is 157.893) 

---

Product link: [https://voting.opensquare.io](https://voting.opensquare.io)

This product is originally funded by w3f grant and you can find the proposal [here](https://github.com/w3f/Grants-Program/blob/master/applications/OpenSquare-offchain-voting.md) and the delivery PR [here](https://github.com/w3f/Grant-Milestone-Delivery/pull/297). We have done a lot of work to improve it, got some achievements and are requesting fund to support the last 4 monthes work after the grant delivery.

## Introduction

In a word, you can see OpenSquare off-chain voting as [snapshot](https://snapshot.org/) implementation in the polkadot ecosystem. Users can create proposal with specified block heights and vote off chain with the user balance as the weight. 

Now the assets it supports including:
- substrate based chain native tokens
- Statemine assets and other assets pallet token on other para-chains
- ORML assets
- ERC20 asset on moonriver and moonbeam

Multiple assets supporting make it possible that voting with one asset from different chains. Currently there are no proposals in kusama space, but we can see we support voting with $KSM from Kusama, Statemine, Karura, Bifrost and Moonriver.

## Use cases

### For substrate chains
Most substrate based chains have onchain governance, but off-chain voting still makes sense with following reasons:
- Voting from multiple chains. It increases the voters' scope.
- Gas free. 
- More flexible strategies for voting result. Currently we support `balance-of`, `qudratic-balance-of` and `biased-voting` to calculate the voting result.

All in all though we have the onchain governance, off-chain voting provides a different way to help community engage more in the governance. We can use it for:
- Discussions with polls. Onchain proposals are usually formal ones which make users not so easy to express their opinions. But we can even raise some controversial topics with off-chain voting.
- It can be used as a 'temperature checking' tool before the final onchain proposal.

### For non chain assets

There are assets in different forms in the dotsama ecosystem. An asset may exists as a Statemine asset, a ORML token, or even a ERC20 token. This off-chain voting tool can be used as their formal governance tool with which nearly all forms of tokens can be used to vote a proposal.

### Examples

Fortunately we've got several users.
- [RMRK](https://voting.opensquare.io/space/rmrk-curation) uses it for the NFT collection curation proposals.
- [Kintsugi](https://voting.opensquare.io/space/kintsugi) uses it to pre-vote before the onchain proposal.
- [Karura](https://voting.opensquare.io/space/karura) created a proposal to collect community opinions for 'kUSD Upgrade to aUSD'.

## Metrics

We've got more users.
![](https://i.imgur.com/JDYY1Xu.png)

## Work and budget

Our work include:
- Support statemine assets
- Support multiple chain voting for one asset
- Support ERC20 token voting
- Components polish.

Please check the [code diff](https://github.com/opensquare-network/collaboration/compare/release-1.2.0...release-1.5.0). We will request about 15 FTE days each month to cover the common structure work. This request doesn't include our customization for the ecosystem projects, and we won't request it from dotsama treasury.

```javascript=
+-----------------------+----------------------+---------+
| Item                  | monthes              | Cost    |
+-----------------------+----------------------+---------+
| Monthly development   | 4(12.2021 - 03.2022) | $30,000 |
| 15 FET day/month      |                      |         |
+-----------------------+----------------------+---------+
| Server(Hetzner cpx41) | 4                    | $99     |
+-----------------------+----------------------+---------+
| Total                 |                      | $30,099 |
+-----------------------+----------------------+---------+
```

Payment conditions:

1. The work is to improve the governance engagement in the dotsama ecosystem, and we request the fund for the common code structure not the customization for ecosystem projects.
2. We will use the 30 day avg rate from Subscan to calculate the total KSM allocation at the day of submission.

items.title: OnFinality High Performance Public Infrastructure (Q1 2022)
items.content:
**Proponent:** ELkVhHcvaP9L43RK9SP6Wn3FBfusEN5EJe2gH7aA2ETiufP

**Date:** 27th April 2022

**Requested KSM:** 276.29 KSM

**Short description:** Ongoing costs for the running of high performance, scalable, and reliable public infrastructure for Kusama and Statemine.

**Raw Data:** https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1SeLZ-N0G55G4JgjncfS-8_kM3L6fWUl5X0SaQMWZ--4/edit?usp=sharing

## Original Motivation

Over the last 3 months (January, February, March 2022) we've provided a scalable free public API service so that everyone can access public pools of managed Kusama and Statemine nodes. This provides the following three outcomes:

- Grow the ecosystem by reducing the barriers to entry to access a high performance nodes
- Help scale existing projects in the ecosystem by providing infrastructure  services that can be depended on
- Assist with the testing of all networks by providing valuable data back to the community on how validator nodes are running and scaling as the network traffic increases (we’ve made GitHub issues based on behaviour we’ve observed)

## Service Details

This last quarter has been huge for Kusama and OnFinality, the demand for our services continues to be another  unprecedented period. January had a larger activity than the rest of the quarter which also had our highest daily response count (for Q1). [Raw data is here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1nPk1_IPvRj4_8Xpn7Wa2KNjrqXW7kRacP9X0nsCo6fQ/edit#gid=1598230413).

This quarter was all about service stabilisation as part of the promise we made to this ecosystem to provide enterprise grade services to the community. Our services all exceeded our 99.9% target, with 99.99% uptime for Polkadot over the last 90 days. This is an important measure as we surpassed our largest ever day, with over a billion API responses processed by our service in a single 24 hour period in late January.

Between 2022-01-01 and 2022-03-31 our Kusama API service has:

- Served a total of 4,975,878,346 (4.9 billion) responses
- Accumulated over 34 TB of data egress
- The highest daily total was 85,238,268 responses in a single 24 hour period
- Our rolling 7 day average at the end of this period was over 49 million responses each day.
- Statemine had over 654 million API responses in the period
- All time totals for Kusama is 1,186,285,385 (1 Trillion) since November, 2020
- At the end of this period the 90 day uptime on Kusama and Statemine was 99.99% and 99.97% respectively

[The full proposal is here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/15ezC2j2KbSatjrDIND67H5w8cZntc0Grgfj2Z3267ko/edit?usp=sharing)

items.title: Proposal for production of educational video tutorials in Spanish
items.content:
Hi! I'm Cervera and I've been producing educational tutorial videos about Polkadot and Kusama since April 19, 2021, just a year ago! Currently, on my [YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsP0zGvvzB4RGyDYHkDdmUA) you can find two playlists, one for [Polkadot](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLbGd7ZIYqZAPR14k1-zSpznR-HSNYHaqa) and one for [Kusama](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLbGd7ZIYqZAP3PysUxiwYGW7aHsC60TnN). Both have 19 videos. Cumulatively, this equates to 42,040 views, 1,085 comments and more than 8,000 watch hours.

The following proposal seeks funding for the production and continued development of the Kusama playlist. Production of video tutorials in Spanish that accompany the user in carrying out functions on the network step by step. These videos explain everything you need to be aware of in a clear and detailed way and show that all the information comes from truthful sources. These educational video tutorials will be created weekly from May 2nd to October 10th.

My goal is to create a complete playlist on the canary network Kusama, where all its functionalities are explained in a simple and clear way so that any Spanish-speaking user feels welcome when starting out in the ecosystem, feels comfortable when carrying out actions and can use the network safely.

Check the full proposal [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wzXd7k55l-nX7cXIdwDnA1WwMIKIVCXYMLprlqMraeY/edit?usp=sharing).

Original post discussions can be found [here](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1471).

Further community feedback may be found on this [tweet](https://twitter.com/cryptonitas_/status/1516360436194717696?s=20&t=kFwOjU9JANdM_ELmYHg2XA).

items.title: dotreasury maintenance from 11.2021 to 03.2022 and statescan maintenace from 01.2022 to 03.2022
items.content:
Proponent: OpenSquare(ESgz7GLVW7BL5DhRgpVnxSXVwaKt4ytWcrf52TY1GQD1cEb)  
Date: 04/26/2022  
Requested Allocation: 100 KSM(EMA30 price on subscan is $167.197)  

---

[OpenSquare team](https://www.opensquare.network/team/) has been maintaining the daily runing of [dotreasury](https://ipfs.dotreasury.com) and [statescan](https://statemine.statescan.io/). Generally the maintaining work includes the monitoring of servers, bug fixes, UI/UX tweaks, small features enhacement, some manual work to add necessary infos, etc. We're requesting fund from kusama treasury to cover the work cost. To reduce the review work we align the requests for dotreasury and statescan, and propose them in one proposal. 

Statescan is now an explorer implementation for Kusama/Polkadot asset parachains. Users can check the fungible and non-fungible assets on it. We have implemented it for Statemine/Statemint/Westmint.

Dotreasury aims to introduce retrospect mechanism for Kusama/Polkadot treasury, while you can see it as a treasury explorer. Check [here](https://www.dotreasury.com/dot/projects/dotreasury) for this project history and [post #352](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/352) for the original discussions.


## Servers

### For statescan

We are using 3 Hetzner vps + a 400G volume for production hosting and 2 contabo vps for development.

Hetzenr vps for deployment:
- vps1: CPX31(4 vcpu + 8G ram + 160G) = €12.4/mo
- Vps2: CPX41(8 vcpu + 16G ram + 240G) = €22.9/mo
- vps3: CPX41(8 vcpu + 16G ram + 240G) = €22.9/mo
- volume 400GB = €16.0/mo

Contabo vps for development:
- vps1: 4v + 8G ram + 200G = $6.99
- vps2: 4v + 8G ram + 200G = $6.99

### For dotreasury:

We are using 2 Hetzner vps + 2 external volumes for the production hosting and 1 contabo vps for development.

Hetzner vps for deployment:

- vps1 for polkadot: vps1: CPX31(4 vcpu + 8G ram + 160G) = €12.4/mo
- vps2 for kusama: vps1: CPX31(4 vcpu + 8G ram + 160G) = €12.4/mo
- volume1 for polkadot: 400GB = €16.0/mo
- volume2 for kusama: 800GB = €32.0/mo


## Continuous development & daily maintenace

### For statescan

- Bug fixes including asset analysis, dot price tracker and the price chart.
- Code refactor including removing useless packages, upgrading dependencies.
- Improve the IPFS parsing scripts so we can parse some NFT images on westmint.
- Collecting and updating some fungible assets info.
- Server deployments and handling issues like scaning stopped by node connection problems.

We will request 4 FTE work cost each month for the work. The total cost will be 4(FTE) * $500(each FTE cost) * 3(monthes) = $6,000.

### For dotreasury

- Support tagging proposal with category and status(working or delivered).
- We deploy it to IPFS, check https://ipfs.dotreasury.com.
- Bug fixes including tip value, project site building scripts, react hash router issues for IPFS deployment.
- Support scenarios that one motion is related with multiple proposals or bounties.
- UI/UX polish like prevent jumping to explorer after clicking the header block number component.
- Daily manual work to update proposal related links and titles.

We will request 4 FTE work cost each month for the work. The total cost will be 4(FTE) * $500(each FTE cost) * 5(monthes) = $10,000.

Payment conditions:

1. The work is for both kusama(Statemine) and polkadot(Statemint), but to make the on-chain work simple, we may apply from kusama and polkadot in turn.
2. We will use the 30 day avg rate from Subscan to calculate the total KSM allocation at the day of submission.

items.title: polkachu.com maintenance treasury proposal - Q1 2022
items.content:
Dear Kusama community

We would like to submit a treasury proposal for the maintenance of polkachu.com for Q1 2022. This quarter, we released two important new product: [Node Snapshots](https://polkachu.com/snapshots) and [Payout Guards](https://polkachu.com/payout_guard). And we continue to maintain a few projects, including a popular dashboard for the Thousand Validators Program, a validator/nominator search portal called Scout and many other smaller features.

Before we submit the proposal on-chain, we initiated a polkassembly discussion [here](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1450). 

The detailed proposal can be found [here](https://github.com/PolkachuIntern/treasury_proposals/blob/main/polkachu_2022q1_maintenance.md). 

Between the initial polkassembly post and today, we made two changes in the detailed proposal:

1. Added $173 snapshot server cost that we initially left out. [Github Commit](https://github.com/PolkachuIntern/treasury_proposals/commit/2ceda89f5413ca5366ba5efe569d642f9334eb02)
2. Updated the Subscan EMA30 number on the day of proposal submission. [Github Commit](https://github.com/PolkachuIntern/treasury_proposals/commit/1c55b9a0b68cad57c4b841bded563c930771b52b)

While our work contributes to both Polkadot and Kusama communities, we believe that the amount is reasonable enough to just ask from the Kusama Treasury. 

Thank you for your consideration!

Polkachu

items.title: Update 2, RPC-node Dwellir
items.content:
This is a follow-up proposal on what we [submitted in December](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1204), to further fund the development of the RPC services and to cover the maintenance costs of it.

This new proposal includes two Milestones.

**Milestone 1:** Continue to run the Kusama and Statemine RPC services on dedicated hardware, to increase the performance of the services.

**Milestone 2:** Continue to develop, support, and push open source code to improve the RPC Performance toolkit. (This toolkit can be used for all Substrate based nodes.) For this next Quarter we aim to implement **Improved Workload Modeling** and **Test Plans**.
### Report

Our Kusama RPC node served on average **5,570,105** requests per day during the last quarter.

In our last Kusama Treasury Proposal we received a grant to troubleshoot and analyze the performance issues of the RPC nodes.

We have [published a report](https://github.com/dwellir-public/rpc-perf/blob/main/report.md) about our findings and developed an [RPC performance toolkit](https://github.com/dwellir-public/rpc-perf/) for node operators.

Thanks to the work we have done with the performance toolkit our RPC service capacity and stability has now increased.

- Our full proposal can be [read here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/15JfkUuuOSHiL4sfyl-M7gp9xoAIMLObzYYMOvSm3zWg/edit?usp=sharing).

items.title: Proposal for funding Chrawnna Corp. Q2 Video Production of Dotsama News, Culture, Trends, Tech, & Education.
items.content:
The video companion to this proposal can be found [here](https://youtu.be/zfj9kz5ctcU)!

The full proposal can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1jozhiL-WIsogqsnYhoPkxpXEZZVmAkneZmiKkfYSsAY/edit?usp=sharing)!

Original PA Discussion post is [here](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1439). 

Further community feedback may be found in the comments of the [video](https://youtu.be/zfj9kz5ctcU) or replies to this [tweet](https://twitter.com/GldnCalf/status/1509515711781158914?s=20&t=993nJS7Ce_oAkgOrszk7hQ).

items.title: Governance Rewarder Proposal - Milestone 2, 3 + General
items.content:
Dear Council,
The first item of the RMRK2 Collection has already been sent out. 

First time voters now receive a [shelf](https://singular.app/collectibles/11922926-3208723ec6f65df810-SHELF-VS-203) and an [item](https://singular.app/collectibles/11922939-3208723ec6f65df810-ITEM-181-203). Each time they vote on a Referendum an additional item gets added to their shelf which they can equip. The first item has been sent out to voters of Referendum 181. This proposal is to cover Milestone 2, 3 + General. My aim now is to make the collection economically viable on its own as to not rely on Treasury spending in the future. This is to be achieved through the creator royalties made possible in RMRK2.0.0

The full [proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TfgM_z3bDznbDa5ee2HBLRoqW10BShwJnD6hmSjODCs/edit?usp=sharing)

Originally I planned to do a pixel collection due to the difficulties I had finding artists. Now that I have a good working relationship with several, it became possible to create a more artsy collection. I adopted some of the ideas brought forward by Bruno in the [original community post](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1358) and thus the current collection was born. While it is not what I promised to build in the original proposal, I trust that the community will agree this to be a more fun and interactive collection. Since I now also incur artist fees for the rmrk2 collection, I hope that everyone sees this change as overdelivering rather than underdelivering.

It has been fun to build this project and I am thrilled to have gotten so much great feedback already. I look forward to continuously improving the collection and driving governance participation further!!!

[A deep dive into the past, the present and the future of the Referendum Voting Rewards Project.](https://app.subsocial.network/6214/referendum-voting-rewards-the-past-the-present-the-future-32141)
