items.title: Governance Rewarder Proposal - Milestone 0, 1
items.content:
Dear community,

Anyone that has found their way over to the democracy tab, knows that currently Kusama still has a dramatic **lack of** community **involvement** in governance. We frequently have appalling voting turnout rates of **less than 1%** or even less than 0.1% on our referenda! This is **not healthy** for the network and in order to become truly **democratic** and **decentralised**, we **NEED** to encourage voting from all members!

With my latest project I decided to tackle this issue specifically! I wrote a program that **automatically rewards** all **voters** with an **NFT** at the end of a referendum. Some of you will have already noticed those NFTs appear in your wallets for the last few referenda. Today I would like to bring forward my spending proposal for the project for community discussion. I would love to get your feedback!

More info on the [project](https://app.subsocial.network/6214/incentivising-referendum-votes-31299).

The full proposal can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TfgM_z3bDznbDa5ee2HBLRoqW10BShwJnD6hmSjODCs/edit?usp=sharing)

The link to the [community discussion](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1358)

items.title: Building the Kusamaverse - milestone 1
items.content:
this proposal covers milestone 1 of the entire project. 

Building the Kusamaverse, a real-time and persistent 3D home for the Kusama ecosystem. Enabling a new way for users to navigate, connect and contribute to and benefit from the Kusama ecosystem.

- Where the Kusama community can gather, engage into on-chain and off-chain activities, tailored to collective value creation, and can build their own social network economy. 

- Where activities like staking, parachain auctions, as well as gatherings, hackathons are directly accessible as a shared experience in the metaverse. 

Kusama is an experimental development environment for teams who want to move fast and innovate, or prepare for deployment on Polkadot. 

There are limitations to what the Kusama community with its current UX can do. The focus of the current applications, mainly polkadot.js, are on on-chain activities, for technically sound individuals using a complex, very detailed, dashboard. In general, there is lots and lots of information to absorb, and most of the time people don’t even know why certain information is there as it has no context to them. 

It is not a social process where you can meet and learn from each other users, nor is the process inviting to non-technical participants. Staking and other on- and off-chain activities could and should be an attractive and fulfilling experience for a wide(r) audience. 
![](https://odyssey.org/_Resources/Persistent/9/3/9/7/93979a20e1ef2dc0ab54c46e5c08355becb205a9/Kusamaverse-1920x1842.webp)
*Artist impression of what the Kusamaverse **could** look like*
![](https://odyssey.org/_Resources/Persistent/0/e/0/1/0e0164c4bbe30a1f92d492c2452fc3baf30f7f3f/Schermafbeelding_2022-02-02_om_09.58.03-1534x1474.webp)

The Kusamaverse will facilitate and boost both off-chain activities (like meetups, incubation of initiatives, policy making) and on-chain activities (like staking, crowd-loans, voting). 

**About the team**

Since 2013, Odyssey has been active in the, as we call it in 2022, Web3-space. We have been involved and supporting Polkadot and Kusama right from the start in 2016, by giving it a platform at our conferences and enabling over 350 teams to build during our hackathons, with Polkadot experts from Parity on-site giving workshops and assisting builders.

![](https://odyssey.org/_Resources/Persistent/a/c/e/2/ace203bb177625b8424742f189f1922bce4636dd/28033836905_cbe97437b9_o-1920x1280.webp)

We organised Europe's biggest blockchain hackathon and multi-stakeholder incubator, with over 100 partners like the European Commission, Dell, KLM, VMware, IUCN, Vattenfall, Engie and several Dutch Ministries. 

![](https://odyssey.org/_Resources/Persistent/4/c/9/6/4c96f84911460c15b563f706d0c4ce092222c46a/46713147705_16fe5b24e8_o-1920x1061.webp)

When COVID hit, we developed the first version of the Momentum software, as a 3D online mass collaboration arena, to host our annual hackathon with 2500 participants. The prototype of this 3d world premiered at the Odyssey Momentum Hackathon, Nov 2020, with 1600 participants collaborating on 21 hackathon challenges, logged in simultaneously, in one massive [multiplayer 3d environment](https://youtu.be/mwpj70Gcatg). 

20 months after this prototype, Odyssey.org now is a digital native foundation established in The Netherlands, with a live product used by several thousand users in multiple 3d worlds that are in production. Anyone can freely experiment and start their initiative in our alpha world: momentum.odyssey.org.

**Proposal**

The current proposal for on-chain submission is for milestone 1. Milestone 2-4 we included to give a look into our future thinking and ideas, to be adapted upon after learnings from milestone 1.

Please find the full proposal [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/18DtpAsYRt7kZYY1XJZrBcbruhkWbKZzwJFKnrtTCG0w/edit?usp=sharing), looking forward to questions and feedback!

items.title: Extrinsics.io - An improved extrinsics builder for Polkadot and Kusama
items.content:
Extrinsics.io is an extrinsics building platform that provides an improved user interface and experience for users in the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystem. It has a fresh new take on building and signing extrinsics that enables both regular users and power users to better understand and utilise the extrinsic builder. It will also provide users of the currently available wallets with tools that help make calls to the network that are not currently available in any of those wallets.

![](https://i.imgur.com/AhQwWGr.png)

Our goal with extrinsics.io is to build a platform that makes it easier for new users to understand and utilise the extrinsic builder with more comfort and ease while also making sure that power users can quickly get to what they are looking for when they have to build an extrinsic. Here are some key points that highlight those changes:

- Unified screen for encoding and decoding extrinsics

- Intuitive Decoder View

- An editable decoder UI

- A better interface for the encoder

You can take a look at the full proposal [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ty52DlBTx9Lf14vzYnIaIBoRC2kaRCU3EG9B_KRZd3E/edit?usp=sharing)

The platform would also support signing of extrinsics functions with both Kusama and Polkadot. We would start with supporting both Kusama and Polkadot networks with the option of extending it to other networks at a later stage.

The proposal consists of just one milestone and an estimated 3 months to complete. After Milestone 0 is completed we plan to make a report that will be shared on Polkassembly and Kusama Direction.


We would love to hear your feedback and get your thoughts around the project. Feel free to leave a comment below, or reach out via email, anytime.

- This submission covers the expenses for the entire proposal.
- Kusama rate at $206.654 as per [Subscan 30 day EMA](https://kusama.subscan.io/tools/charts?type=price)

[Link to the recent discussion on Polkassembly](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1328)

items.title: OnFinality - High Performance Public Infrastructure (Q4 2021)
items.content:
***Ongoing costs for the running of high performance, scalable, and reliable public infrastructure for Kusama and Statemine.***

Over the last 3 months (October, November, December 2021) we've provided a scalable free public API service so that everyone can access public pools of managed Kusama and Statemine nodes.

Between 2021-10-01 and 2021-12-31 our Kusama API service has:
- Served a total of 9,333,324,393 (9 billion) responses (an increase of 16% on the previous quarter)
- Accumulated over 60 TB of data egress (up 7% on Q2)
- The highest daily total was 394,214,930 responses in a single 24 hour period
- Our rolling 7 day average at the end of this period was over 44 million responses each day.
- Statemine had over 314 million API responses in the period
- All time totals for Kusama is 20,233,883,203 (20 Billion) since November

![Q4 data](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vSWsNDzGIGX16MM4vjqaDe_w8JWVoSa-Fl6A71mn-WlKkYumG07PBA2q5KJcSSrQavHUcnEUdGhJpkf/pubchart?oid=1902245037&format=image)

In early October we experienced a surge of activity that took us to our highest daily response count of almost 400 million responses in a single day.

During this period we also noticed additional load on the compute component of our resourcing that we believe is due to over 20 different parachains connecting to the main relay chain and the additional block verification that resulted. We scaled up the compute component of our infrastructure to maintain service levels as a result. Additionally we are closely watching the work that Dwellir is doing in the ecosystem to propose improvements to the RPC nodes.

Additionally, our experience shows significant performance improvements in terms of response times when the CPU usage is less than 50%. We observed a noticeable drop of service quality (in terms of response times) when the node is under load.

This proposal includes combined running costs for our infrastructure for Kusama and Statemine. The total combined running cost is USD $45,949.51

[The full writeup is here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mzROC1pcn6h6awsxdQ0LB1nOLWzUMNZjK8L2kL_3p_A/edit?usp=sharing)

items.title: Proposal for funding production of the week-daily SER, Have ya’ Heard? Community News Digest
items.content:
Hi I’m Jay Chrawnna and I’ve been writing and producing educational, cultural, and news digest videos for the Dotsama community since June 11, 2021 — Now 102 videos across 5 series. Cumulatively this equates to 57,687 views and 3118 watch hours.

The following proposal seeks funding for the ongoing production and development of SER, Have ya’ Heard? (formally Slot Election Reflection) - A week-daily broadcast covering Dotsama news, culture, interviews, tutorials, and trends all with sources displayed on screen and linked in the description.

Funds will cover existing production costs, new marketing initiatives, further development, and expanded community involvement.

See the full proposal [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1A_JZsQj-Jgx1XNPkzvivOaP9kjQ4byV4i-6069gq9Ow/edit?usp=sharing).

Original post discussions can be found [here](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1299).

Further community feedback may be found on this [tweet](https://twitter.com/GldnCalf/status/1484181410105769984?s=20).

All our welcome to leave feedback below!

items.title: SubVT (Subtrate Validator Toolkit) Milestones 4-5 of 5
items.content:
SubVT is a native mobile application for iOS and Android phones, tablets and wearables that provides node operators with tools that aid them in running their validators on any Substrate-based blockchain network.

Please find below the deliverables for milestones 1-3 (covered by [motion 326](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/motion/326)), information on the ongoing work, and outstanding items for milestones 4-5.

This spending proposal is to cover the expenses of milestones 4-5, **18,680.00 EUR** as planned in the initial spending proposal [document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mCD1lRoEwbV3Xp5N-HzEKA0KROCmNkMFInLGd4nAz-k/edit?usp=sharing), equivalent to **82.2314 KSM** with the EUR-USD and USD-KSM ([EMA30](https://kusama.subscan.io/tools/charts?type=price)) exchange rates of 24.02.2022.

We're planning to begin open beta testing in early May initially on Polkadot and Kusama, and release mid-June as we continue with support for more networks and feature updates.

# Milestones 1-3 Deliverables

### Milestone 1
1. Milestone [report](https://github.com/helikon-labs/subvt/tree/main/document/project/01-milestone_01_report.md).
2. Use cases and feature [documentation](https://github.com/helikon-labs/subvt/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Afeature).
3. System architecture [document](https://github.com/helikon-labs/subvt/tree/main/document/software/01-subvt_system_architecture.md).
4. Data definition [document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1gVGHBSqji-XJc6luvLDm3ilq08LMVb2hhC3EqZ5jr5Q/edit?usp=sharing) for design.

### Milestone 2
1. Branding [document](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Bwn919_43cp30fwmVazKl8BEoCmetw6L/view?usp=sharingf).
2. Design [document](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1sZUt4GM0ghOm0bAdAEWUMF-ujsfR_Zbo/view?usp=sharing).
3. Design [assets](https://github.com/helikon-labs/subvt/tree/main/assets/design).
4. UX map on [Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/XzSssIXskyo8aMTc1myClC/?node-id=178:350).
5. UX design on [Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/XzSssIXskyo8aMTc1myClC/?node-id=0:1).
6. Service specifications for REST and WS RPC services.
	1. Application REST service OpenAPI [specification](https://helikon-labs.stoplight.io/docs/subvt/YXBpOjM0Mjg0NzAw-sub-vt-application-service).
    2. Report REST service OpenAPI [specification](https://helikon-labs.stoplight.io/docs/subvt/YXBpOjM0MDAzMjEz-sub-vt-report-service).
	3. Live network status WS RPC service [specification](https://github.com/helikon-labs/subvt-backend/blob/main/subvt-live-network-status-server/README.md).
	4. Validator list WS RPC service [specification](https://github.com/helikon-labs/subvt-backend/blob/main/subvt-validator-list-server/README.md).
	5. Validator details WS RPC service [specification](https://github.com/helikon-labs/subvt-backend/blob/main/subvt-validator-details-server/README.md).

### Milestone 3
1. Backend [implementation](https://github.com/helikon-labs/subvt-backend).
2. UI [design](https://www.figma.com/file/XzSssIXskyo8aMTc1myClC/?node-id=178:603).
3. Landing site design (non-functional) @ [subvt-test.helikon.io](http://subvt-test.helikon.io).

# Work To Do

### Ongoing
1. Time-series database queries for off-chain Telemetry notifications (best/finalized block height, uptime, up/download bandwidth, peer count, transaction queue length).
4. More integration tests and Prometheus integration for the backend.
2. Notification content templates for different channels (push notification, SMS, email - working with the design team for these) and text-to-speech content for GSM calls .
3. Twilio integration for SMS and GSM notifications - near completion.
4. Backend data access frameworks for iOS (Swift) and [Android (Kotlin)](https://github.com/helikon-labs/subvt-data-android).

### Milestone 4
1. Complete iOS and Android application development.
2. Work with the design team for emergent changes.
3. Begin alpha testing.

### Milestone 5
1. Beta testing & QA.

items.title: SNI’s Winter 2022 Hackathon Prizes
items.content:
# Overview

SNI's Winter 2022 Hackathon is a 3-day online event + 1-day showcase. Sovereign Nature Initiative (SNI) is a non-profit foundation that is building on Kusama and has brought together multiple partners and engineers from the **Kusama ecosystem** including [Kodadot](https://nft.kodadot.xyz/), [Unique Network](https://unique.network/), [Kilt Protocol](https://kilt.io/), and [Ocean Protocol](https://oceanprotocol.com/), for **two contests** taking place in two separate areas of SNI's focus. One for tech innovation in the form of a hackathon, and the other as a creative writing competition with NFT generation. Both competitions' results will be showcased in a special "Experimental Zone" in-person event planned for May 21-22 at [De Ceuvel](https://deceuvel.nl/en/) Amsterdam. The pledges we are seeking from the Council will provide prizes to the winners of both contests.

**Venue** : Odyssey Momentum online Hackathon, and De Ceuvel, Korte Papaverweg, Amsterdam, Netherlands.

**Time** : February 4th-6th 2022 and May 21st-22nd 2022

**Beneficiary address:**
G2bC9gtyHBkxmg65nZiZ7pbrV7PMLNXUTwr6dqMUk8KDxXG

**Submitter address:**
 G2bC9gtyHBkxmg65nZiZ7pbrV7PMLNXUTwr6dqMUk8KDxXG

# **Community Spend & Deliverables**

The pledges we are seeking from the Council will provide prizes to enhance the reach and impact of these programs – 15,000.00 USD in prizes for the winners of the contests, which will encourage them to continue building their DApps to full fruition, in a final collaborative effort between SNI and both the contest winners.

### Amount to spend from the community pool

15,000.00 USD in KSM equivalent

### Timeline

 By Jan 27th 2022

### How will funds be spent

All the funds will be given as the prizes to the winners of the contests. As follows:
```
+------------------------------------------+---------------+
|            Contest Breakdown             |    Amount     |
+------------------------------------------+---------------+
| 1st place for the Winter Hackathon       | 10,000.00 USD |
| 1st-5th place prizes for Writing Contest | 5,000.00 USD  |
+------------------------------------------+---------------+
```

# **Why this proposal?**

We believe in Kusama's approach to innovation and its community has proven very supportive to SNI's cause.

Indeed, two Kusama parachain projects, namely Unique.Network and Kilt Protocol, have agreed to support the 28 SNI Hackathon teams by helping them build their solution. Unique.Network will offer NFT minting support and build a marketplace that creates value through NFTs transaction for the benefit of the regenerative projects at De Ceuvel. Kilt Protocol will offer to the teams' developers support on how to work with the KILT SDK, and integrate the Kilt's Verifiable Credentials and DID into their Hackathon solutions.

By getting the councils financial support, the winning team will be able to further develop their solutions after the Hackathon, and further explore and use technology within the Kusama ecosystem. Moreover, this financial support will further the reach and impact of our events, enabling more regen/refi initiatives to be recognized as important players within the Kusama ecosystem.

# **1. About the Tech Hackathon**

We will conduct an **Online Hackathon** from February 4th-6th, asking teams to develop ideas in **3 categories** with possible approaches listed here:

- **representation of non-human life**
  - Artistic expressions in digital media that bring to the public narratives from other forms of life that share our existence and that we co-depend to have a thriving planet
  - Story-telling, UI, UX, user journeys, that aim to broaden the understanding of the public towards other living beings' realities and expressions
- **governance models**
  - Web3 software solutions that tackle a particular aspect of governance for conservation, regeneration, and remediation efforts
  - Treasury management and proposal voting systems
  - New legal/technical governance models, such as a declaration of independence for non-human species
  - Land Stewardship ("Land Trust") and models of public/private/nature governance
- **nature value capture**
  - NFTs as an approach to value generation/eco-awareness where value remains 'in' specific land/ecosystems
  - Creative ways to remunerate data collection about ecosystems
  - Regenerate-to-earn models to incentivize nature stewardship
  - Data analytics and feedback as an autonomization of conservation practices

The 28 teams participating in the event will be encouraged by the judging criteria to build the business and architecture models on top of the Kusama ecosystem, specially the hackathon partners, for a DApp that helps the DeCeuvel organization with another income stream based on its on-site Nature, sensors data, and soil remediation efforts. Learn more about the [SNI Winter Hackathon here](https://sovereignnature.com/projects/odyssey2022).

To participate the teams contacted us via an on-line questionnaire and application form, that was available on our website, twitter, and other media presences. After that the participants were interviewed and vetted. Then they joined a series of events to learn about the De Ceuvel and the Kusama ecosystem partners.

The competition has a prize currently composed of donations - 10,000 $OCEAN and 3,000 $POP - and €5,000 fiat prize from SNI. In addition to that, some $KILT and $RARE will be given out to ramp-up participants to build on the protocol.

**Ultimately through this programming we seek to develop tools which can give nature an identity and make it profitable.**

## Judging Criteria

The judges of the hackathon in collaboration with stakeholders from De Ceuvel will be looking for the DApp ideas that show original and radical thinking while being grounded in technology and applications that can be used by people, and that have potential for practical impact.

Judging criterias are divided into:

- **Originality** - does it do something entirely novel, or at least take a fresh approach to an old problem? A great idea should wow both the judges and other hackers.
- **Usefulness** - is the idea for the App practical? Is it something people would actually use? Does it fulfill a need people caring for De Ceuvel really have?
- **Learning** - did the team factor in all their disposable resources and time in order to come up with the final product? How strong is their awareness of how others are attempting to solve the same problem?
- **Adherence to Theme** - does the idea for the App adhere to the event's themes - the De Ceuvel, the 3 categories, and the Kusama and partners ecosystem? Does it implement each theme fully or just partially?

A score card will be given to each Judge to help assess each DApp idea based on the criterias and scores.

## Hackathon Event Schedule

**February 4: 3 pm - 5 pm** - Hackathon opening convening

SNI presents the challenge and welcome Teams to give a two-minute presentation of their initial ideas and vision

**February 5: 1 pm - 6 pm** - Advisors sessions and Judges visits

Teams meet with Advisors from diverse fields and Judges to validate what they are building. All these meetings will happen in the SNi metaverse

**February 6: 5 pm** - DELIVERABLES DEADLINE

Teams send all deliverables by email to the SNI team

**February 6: 5 pm - 7 pm** - PITCH session

Teams will have a 7-minute slot to present their solutions.

**February 7: 5 pm - 6.30 pm** - Announcing the winning teams

Upon the announcement, winners will be invited to briefly present their solution to the audience and receive (digital) applause and congratulations.

## Judges and mentors

- [**Danielle Bennett**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/danielleabennett), Investor, Blueyard
- [**Trent McConaghy**](http://trent.st/), Co-Founder, Ocean Protocol
- [**Karl Burkart**](https://www.oneearth.org/contributor/karl-burkart/), Deputy Director, OneEarth.org
- [**Ewald Hesse**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/edhesse/) **:** Co-Founder & Supervisory Board Member, SNI; CEO & Co-Founder, Grid Singularity
- [**Andrea Leiter**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/andrea-leiter/) **:** Co-Founder, SNI; Associate Professor of International Law at University of Amsterdam
- [**Catherine Bischoff**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/catherinebischoff/) **:** CEO of SNI

# **2. About the Nature Speaks Writing Challenge**

In the arts sector, we will host and judge an **open creative-writing competition** called _ **"Nature Speaks!"** _ asking for original nature-inspired literature that broadens human perception and helps us question nature's otherness. Creative writers, especially those working in web3 / online spaces and innovative publishing platforms, are invited to submit an original work of prose or poetry in the 'voice' or from the point of view of one or more nonhuman organisms (plant/animal) or any other aspect of nature. Winners and runners-up will see their writing published in an online publication, featured at the Experimental Zone event in Spring 2022, and the first prize winner will see their writing published and minted as an NFT using the support of the Unique.Network parachain.

## How can people participate?

Individuals can submit their pieces by March 15 via a [Google form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfLu7ehHHwlOLSiMuBlMIfva2kWfak1TiDM0bzEzNRm3QfZcg/viewform?vc=0&c=0&w=1&flr=0) accessible via the Sovereign Nature website.

If anyone has questions about Nature Speaks! Literature competition, they can get in touch with SNI Writer in Residence and Challenge lead Seth Bockley at: seth@sovereignnature.com

## Why A Writing Competition?

We at Sovereign Nature Initiative believe that art empowers wider and wilder engagement with our world and with the mysteries of nonhuman life. We believe that writing alongside nature can broaden human perception and help us question nature's otherness. We want to think about ourselves and our language as a metaphor for nature, and not just nature as a metaphor for us. We believe that storytelling has the ability to empower and inspire human communities to listen and look more carefully, to smell, taste and touch the deeply entangled world around us.

We're inspired by storytellers and thinkers like [Rainer Maria Rilke](https://gnomelife.bandcamp.com/album/be-earth-now-joanna-macy-anita-barrows-recite-selections-from-rainer-maria-rilkes-the-book-of-hours), [Sophie Strand](https://www.instagram.com/cosmogyny/), [Richard Powers](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/40180098-the-overstory), [Wendi Yan](https://eco.mirror.xyz/8_z5JQrhmCAVSU6vi4V7_r7M6HQ-pOWuAVdTNPPtIJY) and [Robert Macfarlane](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/2688775-the-wild-places).

## Why Kusama and NFTs?

A work of creative writing is like the experience of an organism in the world: it is non-fungible, non-repeatable, unique. Artists and writers capture the value of human-nonhuman entanglement beyond what we can quantify using standard economic and ecological models. We believe NFTs can help these same artists value and share their work– this technology has already greatly impacted the visual arts ecosystem but has yet to make an equivalent impact on literature. As always, SNI wants to be ahead of the curve and anticipate and pioneer how the most powerful nature-writing of the future will be valued and published.

## The Prizes

The grand prize winner will see their writing made into an NFT by \*[Unique.Network](http://unique.network/).

The winner and runners-up will split a bounty of $5,000 USD in KSM equivalent and be published on SNI's website, and featured in our digital compilation _Leaves of Grass 2.0_ at SNI's Experimental Zone event held at Amsterdam's De Ceuvel in May of 2022.

A judging committee made up of writers and scientists will determine winners based entirely on the originality and affectiveness of the works submitted.

At every resale of the artwork 10% of royalties will be donated to a rewilding or conservation campaign designated by the artist and SNI at time of the NFT's creation.


# **About Sovereign Nature Initiative**

Founded in 2019, Sovereign Nature Initiative (SNI) is a non-profit Netherlands-based foundation that is reconfiguring the intersection between ecology, economy, and emerging web3 technologies, and aims to **achieve a thriving planet by reconfiguring nature's value.** To support this vision, SNI's tech stack is being developed in Substrate while we host hackathons to engage developers communities and get their constant feedback. We have brought together multiple partners and engineers from the Kusama ecosystem including [Kodadot](https://nft.kodadot.xyz/), [Unique Network](https://unique.network/), [Kilt Protocol](https://kilt.io/), and [Ocean Protocol](https://oceanprotocol.com/), and are looking for any other initiative in the Kusama ecosystem that is willing to help us **break the cycle of human domination over 'nature'**. Our February 2022 Hackathon is inspired by [De Ceuvel,](https://deceuvel.nl/en/about/general-information/) a post-industrial reclaimed former shipyard in North Amsterdam that operates as a sustainable planned workplace for creative and social enterprises, a unique land trust, and a laboratory for new ideas. Together with other stakeholders who are part of the SNI ecosystem, the top three winning teams will be invited and have the opportunity to showcase their ideas at a public event at De Ceuvel in Amsterdam in May 2022.

## Applicants:

[**Ewald Hesse**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/edhesse/) **:** Co-Founder & Supervisory Board Member SNI, CEO & Co-Founder at Grid Singularity

[**Florian Schmitt**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/florianschmitt/) **:** Co-Founder & Supervisory Board wMember

[**Andrea Leiter**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/andrea-leiter/) **:** Co-Founder at SNI, Associate Professor of International Law at University of Amsterdam

[**Catherine Bischoff**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/catherinebischoff/) **:** CEO at SNI

[**Jean-Paul Depraz**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/pauldepraz/) **:** CTO at SNI

[**Seth Bockley**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/seth-bockley-b4273a212/) **:** Writer-in-Residence at SNI

[**Kaidlyne Neukam**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/kaidlyne-neukam/) **:** Program Manager & Communications

[**Alessandro Mazzi**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/alessandro-mazzi-7a445970/) **:** Project Manager & Partnerships

items.title: Statescan maintenance from 09.2021 to 12.2021
items.content:
Copied from [post 1284](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1284)

The EMA30 on [subscan](https://kusama.subscan.io/tools/charts?type=price) at my proposal time is 279.211, so the final amount is 25.82 KSM. Thanks.

---

Statescan is now an explorer implementation for Kusama/Polkadot asset parachains. We have implemented Statemine/Statemint/Westmint. We’re requesting the maintenance fee for the last 4 months(09.2021-12.2021).
## Servers
We use 3 Hetzner vps + a 400G volume for production hosting and 2 contabo vps for development.

Hetzenr vps:
- vps1: CPX31(4 vcpu + 8G ram + 160G) = €12.4/mo = $14.20/mo
- Vps2: CPX41(8 vcpu + 16G ram + 240G) = €22.9/mo = $26.22/mo
- vps3: CPX41(8 vcpu + 16G ram + 240G) = €22.9/mo = $26.22/mo
- volume 400GB = €16.0/mo = $18.32/mo

Contabo vps:
- vps1: 4v + 8G ram + 200G = $6.99
- vps1: 4v + 8G ram + 200G = $6.99

Expsense:

```javascript=
+----------------+--------+---------+
| Item           | months | Cost    |
+----------------+--------+---------+
| Hetzner vps1   | 4      | $56.8   |
+----------------+--------+---------+
| Hetzenr vps2   | 1      | $26.22  |
+----------------+--------+---------+
| Hetzner vps3   | 1      | $26.22  |
+----------------+--------+---------+
| Hetzenr volume | 4      | $73.28  |
+----------------+--------+---------+
| Contabo vps1   | 2      | $13.98  |
+----------------+--------+---------+
| Contabo vps2   | 2      | $13.98  |
+----------------+--------+---------+
| Total                   | $210.48 |
+----------------+--------+---------+
```

## Continuous development & daily maintenace
We keep actively developing to improve the product, and generally what we did includes:
- We integrated [Statemint](https://statemint.statescan.io/). It requres work like theme design, DOT price track, code refactor, block meta scan, etc.
- Performance improvement
  - Home page search performace improvement
  - Block/extrinsic/events first list page perforce improvement by introducting cache
- Feature enhacement like extrinsic/events filter improvment, 404/500 and other error pages customizatioin, extrinsic/events params shown improvement, etc.
- Bug fixes includes nft/asset approvals, destroyed assets holders, etc.
- Create google form to collect asset info.
- Monitor scripts are created to check the service failure and restart the services.

we request one developer 14 days work cost for last 4 months, and it's $500 * 14 = $7,000.

## Metrics
Please check the 30 days and 24 Hours metrics from cloudflare. 
![](https://i.imgur.com/Cu2RWn6.png)

![](https://i.imgur.com/8nSJyRs.png)

## Total cost & payment conditions

```javascript=
+------------------------------+-------------------+---------+
| Item                         | Duration          | Cost    |
+------------------------------+-------------------+---------+
| Servers                      | 09.2020 - 12.2020 | $210.48 |
| (see details in above table) |                   |         |
+------------------------------+-------------------+---------+
| Continuous development       | 09.2020 - 12.2020 | $7,000  |
| and daily maintenance        |                   |         |
+------------------------------+-------------------+---------+
| Total                                            | $7,210  |
+------------------------------+-------------------+---------+
```

Payment conditions:

1. The work is for both kusama(Statemine) and polkadot(Statemint), but to make the on-chain work simple, we apply from kusama and polkadot in turn every 4 monthes.
2. We will use the 30 day avg rate from Subscan to calculate the total KSM allocation at the day of submission.

items.title: Nomi Tool Proposal: Nomi is a decision support tool for Nominators in NPoS networks
items.content:
**Nomi**, by TurboFlakes, aims to engage Nominators in the community in active staking as well as improve the nomination experience, by presenting a fresh and new visual way of:

1. Selecting the best performing Validators in the network
2. Getting recommendations with the latest top ranked Validators
3. Displaying a contextual call to action to nominate

![](https://i.imgur.com/ilDaMoz.png)

With this proposal we intend to further develop our previous tool released to the community earlier this year. This includes rebranding, a new fresh look and a bunch of new cool features that we think the Polkadot and Kusama community will find useful.

The full proposal with a detailed description and costs can be found here:
[https://hackmd.io/@dE-4mfAUSPqIubXD8Bl50Q/Bk39ZHD5Y](https://hackmd.io/@dE-4mfAUSPqIubXD8Bl50Q/Bk39ZHD5Y)

Before writing this Treasury proposal, we took a step further. We  decided to make several optimizations in our current codebase and implement most of our new Design guidelines. As a result we decided to publish our new site and **Nomi v2-beta**. Please try it out here → [beta.turboflakes.io](https://beta.turboflakes.io/#/kusama?#nomi). 

Any feedback is welcome.

Please review our full [proposal](https://hackmd.io/@dE-4mfAUSPqIubXD8Bl50Q/Bk39ZHD5Y).

items.title: Proposal: Update 1, RPC-node Dwellir
items.content:
This is a follow-up proposal on what we [submitted in August](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/910), to further fund the development of the RPC service and to cover the maintenance costs of it.

This new proposal includes two Milestones. 

**Milestone 1:** Run the Kusama RPC service on new dedicated hardware, to increase the performance of the service.

**Milestone 2:** Onboard a Rust developer to work with the RPC code to make it use resources much more efficiently. We found a problem, during the last quarter, with the scaling of the RPC-service and have spent a lot of time troubleshooting this bottleneck. We published a report in this [Github-issue](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/issues/4064#issuecomment-979449201) about it. This optimization work will reduce the cost for all RPC service providers in the community. 


This proposal only covers Milestone 1 and 2 for now, while in upcoming maintenance proposals we will submit Milestone 1 (continued maintenance) and Milestone 3 (further development of the RPC code).

- Our RPC service is online and the pull request can be [found here](https://github.com/polkadot-js/apps/pull/6620). 
- Our full proposal can be [read here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1B1AjPj8yfi4JPvR0sCdh0sdBGGduIPkeRxAwTpPGD-U/edit?usp=sharing). 
- KSM rate base on 30 day avg tool by Subscan: [Available HERE](https://kusama.subscan.io/tools/charts?type=price)

items.title: Polkashots.io maintenance
items.content:
This treasury proposal is Between the Kusama Council and MIDLDEV OÜ, a company registered in Estonia with registry number 14973249, commonly known as MIDL.dev.

## Service description

* A functioning infrastructure to provide usable blockchain database snapshots for the Kusama network, to the benefit of node operators and validators,
* New snapshots at least once per day. Snapshots are filesystem dumps of the Kusama node storage backend files, of variety RocksDb, of type pruned, with a depth of 1000 blocks, compressed in 7z format, that can be used by validators to quickly spin up or restore their infrastructure,
* A website frontend at polkashots.io with relevant metadata and download links, including a permanent link that always redirects to the most recent snapshot,
* Best effort incident and problem management,
* Redundant implementation setup which allows for continuity, seamless upgrades and basic disaster recovery & contingency management.

## Context
Node operators must have a contingency plan for loss of storage. For us at MIDL.dev, it consists of regularly taking snapshots of the node filesystem and backing it up for recovery if needed. We regularly generate these archives for our own benefit as well as the community. All cloud automation code used for generation of snapshots is [open-source](https://github.com/midl-dev/polkadot-snapshot-generator) so node operators can easily replicate the setup in order to be in full control of the generated snapshots.

The website polkashots.io has been operational for a year now and providing Polkadot and Kusama pruned snapshots for validators. It has had excellent uptime. It is very frequently mentioned in the Validator Lounge Matrix channels and there are youtube videos referencing them. It is beneficial to the ecosystem by providing a path for validators to quickly and safely recover from a storage failure or migrate their operations.

## Alternatives

The warp sync feature has been implemented in Polkadot 0.9.9, however it still requires several hours for a full sync.

A unique snapshot service that many independent validators relies on constitues a centralization risk. It remains our hope that other ecosystem participants will step in and offer an alternative service.

## Operational expenses

The labor cost is 660 EUR/month including 2 engineers in 2 geographical locations (Western US and Western Europe).

In addition, we pass along the cloud costs with a 30% markup.

Polkashots is hosted on google cloud. Google cloud has the concept of "projects" which allows for segregation of costs. The cloud cost is determined as follows:

* from June 1 to October 10, 2021, polkashots was hosted in a google cloud project shared with other MIDL.dev services named "MIDLUS" for which we estimate about 30% of the costs were incurred by generation and download of Kusama snapshots.
* from October 11, 2021 to November 30, 2021, we moved polkashots to a dedicated google cloud project named "MIDLPS", allowing for the most precise cost calculation. We arbitrarily allocate 50% of these costs to Polkadot and 50% to Kusama. A dedicated project for each network would incur overhead costs that we do not feel are necessary.

A majority of these costs are network egress. Google cloud egress costs are in the higher range, similar to Azure and Amazon. Google cloud has two tiers, premium ($0.12/Gb for most regions) and standard ($0.85/Gb for most regions). The premium tier is using google private network across the globe. Polkashots uses the premium tier.

The costs have gone upwards after the introduction of parachains. This is due to the increased storage requirement of the relay chain node in the presence of parachains: as of this writing, a pruned kusama node with 1000 blocks uses 50Gi of storage (7z compressed). In other terms, it costs the treasury $6 each time someone downloads a Kusama snapshot.

The usage of the best cloud platform money can buy is justified by the benefits: a faster download speed and better reliability means that the nodes are more apt to recover quickly in case of accidental loss of storage, making the entire network more resilient.

Screenshots of the billing console are attached for reference.

## Usage

From the MIDLPS billing screenshot, we can see 17,262 Gibibytes of download from the period Oct 10-Nov 31 from all regions excluding Asia and Australia. Polkadot snapshot size is 17Gi and Kusama snapshot size is 50Gi, so assuming a medium download file size of 34Gi, there were 500 downloads during the period, or **10 downloads per day**. This is a combined figure for Polkadot and Kusama networks.

## Note

This proposal is for the Kusama portion of polkashots. We will be submitting a similar proposal to the Polkadot council.

## Budget

```
| Cost item                                      | cost             |
|------------------------------------------------|------------------|
| Labor, monthly                                 | 660 EUR /mo      |
| Labor, total for period                        | 3960 EUR         |
| Cloud costs, MIDLUS June-Oct 10                | 7,737.79 EUR     |
| 30% Kusama portion, MIDLUS + 30% markup        | 3,017.74 EUR     |
| Cloud costs, MIDLPS Oct 11-Nov                 | 2,983.69 EUR     |
| 50% Kusama portion, MIDLPS + 30% markup        | 1,939.40 EUR     |
| Cloud costs, total for period                  | 4,957.14 EUR     |
| Domain name, annually                          | 28 EUR/year      |
| Domain name, total for period                  | 14 EUR           |
| Total for period                               | **8,931.14 EUR** |
| Exchange rate KSM/EUR 2021-12-14 EMA30          | 289.96 (327.273 USD)    |
| Total base price in KSM                        | 30.80              |
| Slippage + conversion fee 5%                   | 1.54              |
| Proposal (KSM)                                 | 32.34             |
```

![](https://i.imgur.com/RSV2fZS.png)
![](https://i.imgur.com/T74SsKq.png)

items.title: Patract Labs' maintenance cost for Kusama of 2021
items.content:
this is copy from [https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1205](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1205)

Patract is developing development tools and services for Polkadot’s Wasm contract technology. With the support of Polkadot Treasury, we have completed the development, report, and external review of [Himalia](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/428) and [Ask!](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1059). However, in the past six to twelve months, the underlying technology of Wasm contracts led by Parity has undergone tremendous breaking changes, so we continued to contribute our developers for long-term maintenance. Among them, the function changes of [Pallet-Contracts](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/projects/6#column-5694481) and [ink!](https://github.com/paritytech/ink) mainly include

- **Change of Pallet-contracts**
    - Refactors
        - [PR#9838](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/9838) contracts: Refactor dispatchables
        - [PR#8604](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/8604) contracts: Refactor the exec module
        - [PR#9669](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/9669) remove rent contracts: Remove state rent
    - update about host_func
        - [PR#10366](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/10366) Stabilize "seal1" seal_call
        - [PR#9609](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/issues/9609) Contracts pallet - Add support for recovering public key from elliptic curve signatures (ECDSA) 
    - update about debug_message 
        - [PR#9550](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/9550) Stabilize seal_debug_message
        - [PR#9051](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/issues/9051) seal_debug_message not showing up in process output
    - update about wasm executor
        - [PR#10173](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/10173) Refactor sp-sandbox; make sure both sandbox executors are always tested
        - [PR#10268](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/10268) Forward wasmer-sandbox feature to sp-sandbox
        - [PR#5920](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/5920) Integrate Wasmer into Substrate sandbox environment
- **Change of ink!**
    - [PR#792](https://github.com/paritytech/ink/pull/792) Implement seal_debug_message
    - [PR#914](https://github.com/paritytech/ink/pull/914) Implemented ECDSA recover function.
    - [PR#903](https://github.com/paritytech/ink/pull/903) Cleanup metadata codegen slightly
    - [PR#845](https://github.com/paritytech/ink/pull/845) Update to scale-info 1.0, introduce metadata format versioning
    - [PR#665](https://github.com/paritytech/ink/pull/665) Implement new trait definition codegen rocket
    - [PR#997](https://github.com/paritytech/ink/pull/977) Use edition 2021

In addition, we paid a lot of cloud server and bandwidth costs for API service [Elara](https://elara.patract.io). The following is a summary of the maintenance work and cost of each product in the past year:

### Himalia (12 months)

Himalia is our Wasm contract multi-language SDK, divided into Go/Python version. More than a year ago, we completed the development of [version 0.2](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/428). After that, the maintenance work of the Github repo are as follows:

- [PatractGo](https://github.com/patractlabs/go-patract/):
    - Submitted [16 Commits](https://github.com/patractlabs/go-patract/commits/master).
    - Updated version to support metadata14 format modification
    - Update all test cases to support the latest version of ink!
    - Add erc721 example
    - Add delegator test cases for contract mutual calls
    - Fix other discovered problems
- [PatractPy](https://github.com/patractlabs/py-patract):
    - Added [6 Commits](https://github.com/patractlabs/py-patract/commits/master).
    - Updated version to support metadata14 format modification
    - Update all test cases to support the latest version of ink!

The maintenance costs are:

- 1 maintainer * monthly salary $200 * duration 12 months = $2400

### Elara for Kusama (12 months), Statemine (7 months), Westend (8 months), Westmint (7 months)

Elara is a node API service similar to Ethereum Infura. By building a middleware service layer, we can provide large number of users to visit by a small number of nodes. More than a year ago, we completed the development of [version 0.2](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/post/566). After that, the main maintenance cost is from maintainer and cloud service.

maintenance cost ($74980) :

- 1 maintainer * monthly salary $500 * duration 12 months = $6000
- The total cost of Alibaba Cloud service in Singapore is  $68980 (434579 CNY), the details are as follows:
    * The unit price of each service is: ![](https://i.imgur.com/AvJAO8g.png)
    * Resources and costs actually consumed by each network：![](https://i.imgur.com/KNMXpNB.png)
    * This is the screenshot of the Alibaba Cloud bill, the total cost is 805773 CNY, from which the Polkadot/ Statemint services should be paid by the Polkadot Treasury are 204969 CNY, and the Kusama/ Statemine/ Westend/ Westmint services should be paid by the Kusama Treasury are 434579 CNY, the rest are for other community chains. ![](https://i.imgur.com/sTdr23e.png)
    * This is the screenshot of the Elara website statistics, total is 97352 GB / 6.06 Billion Requests, from which the traffic for Polkadot/Statemint is 18693 GB, for Kusama/ Statemine/ Westend/ Westmint is 77572 GB, the rest are for other community chains. ![](https://i.imgur.com/zpmA37M.png)

### Summary (2021)

$2400 (Himalia) + $6000 (Elara maintainer) + $68980 (Elara cloud) = $77380 / Monthly avg price of KSM $330 = 234 KSM

items.title: Nova Wallet Proposal: DApp browser, Statemine/Statemint integration, NFT support, Staking & UI rework and improvements
items.content:
**Nova Wallet Proposal: DApp browser, Statemine/Statemint integration, NFT support, Staking & UI rework and improvements**
[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1W5EYOi8lxE6Xx3Zk9TKKrCOPGLYxqlcgjm0fgw5gaow/](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1W5EYOi8lxE6Xx3Zk9TKKrCOPGLYxqlcgjm0fgw5gaow/edit#heading=h.bluxnxoat0y8)
![](https://i.postimg.cc/wBYjwb94/Nova-Git-Hub.png)
**Feature set of the proposal (see [proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1W5EYOi8lxE6Xx3Zk9TKKrCOPGLYxqlcgjm0fgw5gaow/edit#heading=h.bluxnxoat0y8))**
- DApp browser implementation
- Statemine/Statemint tokens integration
- Uniques (NFT) pallet integration, RMRK v1 integration
- Staking & overall UI rework/improvements based on community feedback

\
\
**Context of the proposal**
\
\
             **Nova Wallet** ([website](https://novawallet.io/)) is iOS/Android mobile app for Polkadot & Kusama ecosystem, supporting multi-asset (more than 15 networks), DOT/KSM staking, DOT/KSM crowdloans & convenient, secure account management.

             We are a former team which created & developed Fearless Wallet (except branding), recently decided to start **Nova Foundation** company & fork our work to continue **building high quality applications for the Polkadot & Kusama ecosystem**, with Nova Wallet being our first product ([announcement](https://twitter.com/NovaWalletApp/status/1454853382355697664)). 

             Our goal for **Nova Wallet** is to build **open source**, **community oriented** mobile applications which will be **unbiased to any network**, provide **as many features as possible to the user, without any limitations/restrictions.**

             During our transition period, **we have finished what our team has promised to Kusama Council & community in terms of a Multi-asset proposal** ([link](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/treasury/102)) (see [Nova public demos](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1W5EYOi8lxE6Xx3Zk9TKKrCOPGLYxqlcgjm0fgw5gaow/edit#heading=h.rftd8p1dxege)). The development and transition expenses were covered by the donation from DFG ([link](https://twitter.com/NovaWalletApp/status/1457710380537585665)).

             This proposal covers further evolution of Nova Wallet as a mobile application in the Polkadot ecosystem, **aiming to extend the feature** set of mobile applications by **allowing users to connect to any web app** (DApp) in the ecosystem, **interact with Statemine/nt assets** (tokens, NFT), and **improve existing feature set based on community feedback**.
\
\
\
**Please review the full proposal with a detailed description & costs:**
[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1W5EYOi8lxE6Xx3Zk9TKKrCOPGLYxqlcgjm0fgw5gaow/](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1W5EYOi8lxE6Xx3Zk9TKKrCOPGLYxqlcgjm0fgw5gaow/edit#heading=h.bluxnxoat0y8)

items.title: Kusama Spending Proposal - Educational Music Video (Phase 2), Polkadot and Kusama Networks protocols and dynamics by NibbleBits
items.content:
An educational video on Polkadot and Kusama Networks elements, dynamics and protocols in place to visualize the Polkadot ecosystem structure. This proposal covers phase 2 of the project. 

Although the White Paper and other technical articles about Polkadot and Kusama protocols aim to educate in the understanding of this technology, it is hard for token holders to visualise how the protocol works in an integrated way - this project aims to provide one of the possible visual interpretations of the dynamics behind Polkadot and its elements. The intricacies of showcasing in detail how the Kusama and Polkadot protocols function adds multiple levels of complexities to consider, when designing a piece in conjunction with a preexisting piece of music. This project should be understood as an experiment for educational purposes, playing with the interpretation of a track rhythm and the design chosen to represent the stages of the protocol processes in place, with the goal to understand Kusama's and Polkadot's architecture.

We're happy to conclude Phase 1 of the project and present you our work so far, as well as the laid out plan for Phase 2.

Link to Phase 2 of the proposal can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AmiokdP7Re4O6YA9ribIgUwQkb07QVhT9BLxaWuyp0g/edit?usp=sharing)

Link to the previous Phase 1 which was approved can be found [here](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/motion/353)

- Link to Phase 1 report can be found [HERE](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/motion/353#929c5265-ba06-4c2c-89a0-06674bf3950e).

items.title: Proposal: Maintenance and future development of Parachains.info
items.content:
**Proponent:** DQKDxdDvG6CMPasExAHC9H9VSpB6d8CcKnspphwXs28FzC6

**Date:** 10.11.2021

**Requested USD:** USD 14,728.00 Quarterly (USD 4,909.33 Monthly)

**Short description:** Parachains.info provides users of the Polkadot ecosystem with a centralised repository of unbiased information regarding parachain projects and auctions.  This proposal seeks to obtain funding for the continued operation, maintenance and development of the website. 

**Problem Statement:**
Parachains are a fundamental aspect of the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystems.  It can however be a daunting task to find information on these projects or to compare them directly.  This is prevalent during auction periods in which would-be crowd loaners examine prospective candidates. 

The auction mechanism within the ecosystem also has some complexities, it possesses two phases and a random bid winner assessment point.  Present auction interfaces focus primarily on which project has raised the most capital.  There was no public tool that represented the auction events on a timeline.  This representation was useful when examining the events of auction nine (9), in which a project won due to the timing of the candle end.

The full details of the proposal can be found using this [link](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XG5AnLF5lJtz-Muxqx801ndh_wDN1iWOPk7-2brJGbc/edit?usp=sharing)

- Kusama rate at $405.583 as per [Subscan 30 day EMA](https://kusama.subscan.io/tools/charts?type=price)
- Discussion was initiated here -> [https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1091](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1091) but no feedback was received.

items.title: Speck Wallet - A new user-friendly wallet extension for the Polkadot ecosystem
items.content:
Speck wallet is a user-friendly web extension that will allow Kusama and Polkadot users to interact with their respective networks within the following browsers: Chrome, Firefox, Safari and Brave. The extension would come with the following features:
- Sending and receiving funds
- Address book
- Multi-wallet support - with the goal of having a single wallet focused UI
- Realtime fiat balance with multiple fiat currency options
- Access management for apps using the extension
- Developer documentation for integrating the extension
- Built in support for staking
- Hardware wallet support
- And much more…

You can take a look at the full proposal [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1y3M4A834EcQoV4Qnq-P1HD2L940HDr0e-Xh8QXLrA4U/)

The extension would start with supporting both **Kusama** and **Polkadot** networks with the option of extending it to other networks at a later stage.

The proposal would consist of 3 milestones with each milestone being an on-chain submission. The milestone payments would alternate between Kusama and Polkadot with Kusama being the first one.

We would love to hear your feedback and get your thoughts around the project. Feel free to leave a comment below, or reach out via email, anytime.

- This submission covers Milestone 1

- Kusama rate at $403.06 as per [Subscan 30 day EMA](https://kusama.subscan.io/tools/charts?type=price)

[Link to recent discussion on Polkadot Discussion.](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/1085)

items.title: Pinknode - Proposal: Improved dashboard for managing infrastructure
items.content:
*This proposal for Kusama Treasury covers half of the estimated budget, the other half will be covered by Polkadot Treasury which has already been [approved.](https://polkadot.subscan.io/treasury/71)

Pinknode is a node-as-a-service platform specialized in providing quality API endpoints and node operation services to the users in the Polkadot ecosystem. Our mission is to support the Polkadot protocol in achieving its vision of a multi-chain future through providing easy-to-use, reliable, and scalable infrastructure services which removes an entire layer of complexities for developers to start building on Polkadot/Substrate.

We launched our MVP in June 2021 offering free API endpoint access to users to both Polkadot and Kusama mainnets and testnets. We've served more than 200 million requests through our users' custom endpoints and public endpoints. You may begin utilizing our endpoints by [signing up for an account](https://app.pinknode.io/login) or through our public endpoints listed [here](https://apps.pinknode.io/#/explorer).

In our Phase 1 proposal, we will be detailing our plan to enhance our front-end for better user experience, management and monitoring capabilities. With these planned enhancements, our users will be able to:

- easily manage their project keys

- uncover valuable insights into their usage methods and patterns, which will positively influence the development of their dApp

- collaborate effectively with other team members to manage infrastructure needs

This will help advance the developer team’s operational capabilities by providing greater ease of use, visibility, and enhanced account management.

You can find out more about our proposal [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XBWBRNuEl1bJBfiD1TyEZN-k4PonabV2Wr7p8DKED1E/edit?usp=sharing)

- This submission covers Phase 1

- Kusama rate at $347.19 as per [Subscan 30 day EMA](https://kusama.subscan.io/tools/charts?type=price)

[Link to recent discussion on Polkadot Discussion](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/post/626).

items.title: Social Contract between Polkassembly and Kusama Treasury
items.content:
[Polkassembly](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/) is an integral part of polkadot and kusama governance. This submission proposes a recurring payment (quarterly) to cover maintenance, operations and human resource costs for Polkassembly, including general maintenance, runtime upgrades changes and could/infrastructure cost for q4. Since Polkassembly supports both Kusama and Polkadot Networks, this maintenance proposal will alternate networks for submission every three months. This submission covers costs for October, November, December of 2021. We are requesting the Kusama treasury to provide funds this time.

items.title: OnFinality - High Performance Public Infrastructure (Q3 2021)
items.content:
[**Full report including detailed data and costing**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1C7QVo0YCepSk70p3fQKihmoJs9YZunoI_771yxBNRJY/edit?usp=sharing)

### Original Motivation

Over the last 3 months (July, August, September 2021) we've provided a scalable free public API service so that everyone can access public pools of managed Kusama, Rococo, and Statemine nodes. This provides the following three outcomes:

- Grow the ecosystem by reducing the barriers to entry to access a high performance nodes
- Help scale existing projects in the ecosystem by providing infrastructure  services that can be depended on
- Assist with the testing of all networks by providing valuable data back to the community on how validator nodes are running and scaling as the network traffic increases (we’ve made Github issues based on behaviour we’ve observed)

### Service Details

Between 2021-07-01 and 2021-09-30 our Kusama API service has:

- Served an unprecedented total of 8,033,980,647 (8 billion) requests (an increase of 210% on the previous quarter)
- Accumulated almost 56 TB of data egress (up 335.54% on Q2)
- The highest daily total was 229,333,292 requests and 1.5TB data egress in a single 24 hour period
- Our rolling 7 day average at the end of this period was over 145 million requests each day.
- Rococo had over 75 million API requests in the period, and Statemine over 186 million
- All time totals for Kusama is 10,895,178,172 (10 Billion) since November
- The last billion Kusama requests took only 7 days
Note: We have implemented custom middleware in our platform that counts and logs these requests, [you can view the raw data here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IgNgwGNQle-8xzS7W3A7PmXX-rI08pknAhG-hllcfw0/edit?usp=sharing).

![](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vRfLGHvC9UgKOU0AFSxOjbtqjm81OBXlSvYt70fK6uGqB1sE0WvPXKRdWv5J3Rf3egvV6pP1cLFZunS/pubchart?oid=577419954&format=image)

### Enhancements

Additionally, we are proud to have delivered some key service enhancements that benefit the Kusama ecosystem in the last quarter. This includes:

- An improved dashboard for our partners so that they can monitor usage and manage the upgrades of the nodes in real time.
- Collection of a rich set of metrics and usage data that is securely shared with partners to help them scale and develop their network.
- Improvements to our routing strategies and scale enhancements to our load balancer with the goal of scaling to a Billion daily requests.
- A variety of improvements to our health metric collection tools and automated recovery scripts to ensure our 99.9% SLA is met.
- Scale improvements to our team, processes, and systems to allow us to provide this same service to **every **parachain team at launch

You can always see live data on our API service on our public [status page](https://status.onfinality.io/).

We continue to reaffirm our dedication to providing free support of 500,000 requests to our API service each day for users around the world. You can access our public API service by connecting to it using [Polkadot.js](https://polkadot.js.org/apps/?rpc=wss%3A%2F%2Fkusama.api.onfinality.io%2Fpublic-ws#/explorer) or via the endpoints listed below. You can also [create your own free API key in our application](https://app.onfinality.io) and track metrics and statistics.

- https://kusama.api.onfinality.io/public
- wss://kusama.api.onfinality.io/public-ws
- https://rococo.api.onfinality.io/public
- wss://rococo.api.onfinality.io/public-ws
- https://statemine.api.onfinality.io/public
- wss://statemine.onfinality.io/public-ws

[**Full report including detailed data and costing**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1C7QVo0YCepSk70p3fQKihmoJs9YZunoI_771yxBNRJY/edit?usp=sharing)

items.title: Encointer pre-launch expenses to become common good parachain
items.content:
Encointer is determined to launch its "mainnet" as a common good parachain on Kusama. This proposal is the next step and covers the preparation tasks and operation expenses to prepare for the onboarding.

Thanks to all the councillors who have already expressed their support for Encointer's ambition by casting their [off-chain vote](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/914) or letting us know privately.

* [proposal description, budget and roadmap](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Hfofao18fZBK2XxLTZaYAougW2-_tB8UVsEUKVQi4n0/edit?usp=sharing)
* [In depth polkassembly discussion on the common good character of Encointer](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/610)
* [Kusama council town hall video recording](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TSf1vfsA_O3wVhgmFa_Fw22vpuAmSIOY/view?usp=sharing)

# common good social contract

If you support this treasury proposal, you're also expressing your current support for Encointer to get a common good parachain slot:
* before slot 20 
* for 8 lease periods (Encointer communities grow slowly by design, so we need time to show impact)

Towards the end of our granted lease, the following shall be assessed to decide about extending the common good slot lease:
* Has Encointer implemented a viable solution with regard to its [whitepaper](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1912.12141.pdf)?
* Has a first pioneer community evolved into an active ecosystem where a growing number of participants is actively using Encointer currency?
* Has an integration with another parachain been demonstrated to provide sybil-defense?
* Is there an interest to launch more communities? How many communities have evolved and how active are they?
* Has the Encointer Association shown good governance and is there a plausible roadmap towards full decentralization?

# funds

items.title: Kusama Spending Proposal - Educational Music Video, Polkadot and Kusama Networks protocols and dynamics by NibbleBits
items.content:
Nibble bits is a creative duo from London, England with over a decade of Visual Effects experience on shows like Jungle Book, which they won an Academy Award for. They've also been honored to work alongside many amazing artists and projects like Ed Sheeran & Chance The Rapper’s music video, The Last of Us 2 trailer, Xbox Series X cinematic, Ridley Scott’s Hennessy short-film and brands such as Apple, Samsung, Heineken, amongst others. In reality though, ‘Nibble bits’ is just the lovechild of two artists making art outside the boundaries imposed by the commercial world.

Although the White Paper and other technical articles about Polkadot and Kusama protocols aim to educate in the understanding of this technology, it is hard for token holders to visualise how the protocol works in an integrated way - this project aims to provide one of the possible visual interpretations of the dynamics behind Polkadot and its elements. The intricacies of showcasing in detail how the Kusama and Polkadot protocols function adds multiple levels of complexities to consider, when designing a piece in conjunction with a preexisting piece of music.

This project should be understood as an experiment for educational purposes, playing with the interpretation of a track rhythm and the design chosen to represent the stages of the protocol processes in place, with the goal to understand Kusama's and Polkadot's architecture. 
Nevertheless, the focus should primarily be an amazing looking music video with addictively compelling aesthetics that can be enjoyed as a piece in its own right.

Link to the full proposal can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1E14oPe0YU8jXA7Rp4khelZwGTNqJsFfEUTi9tRpVrDo/edit?usp=sharing)

We're looking forward to any feedback and comments. Really excited to be part of this!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
KSM rate based on 30-day average rate tool by subscan - $345

Please note this proposal covers the first allocation for the work of two months. 

A second final proposal will be submitted after pending council review of the progress report.

items.title: Proposal: Kusama RPC-node Dwellir
items.content:
Most clients that need to connect to the Kusama network are dependent on RPC nodes to interact with the network. Should the set of existing registered RPC nodes be unavailable, many users will not be able to access the Kusama chain.

This proposal is about funding further development of the RPC service and to cover the maintenance costs of it. The specific development is about **deployment automation** (JuJu Charm) and using multiple **DNS registrars**. 

We have already submitted a Pull Request for our RPC service, it can be [found here](https://github.com/polkadot-js/apps/pull/6024).

Our full proposal can be [read here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Em6VqE0KUDfMF_o370yJXk98UVDNr7Ao4IvpU7reAnE/edit?usp=sharing).

- This proposal covers M1 improvements for the running RPC nodes and the first 3 months for maintenance while working on improvements. 
- PR to merge RPC Nodes service to Polkadot.js Apps can be found [HERE](https://github.com/polkadot-js/apps/pull/6024).
- KSM rate base onf 30 day avg tool by Subscan: Available [HERE](https://kusama.subscan.io/tools/charts?type=price)

items.title: Integrate Statemine interaction into UI of KodaDot
items.content:
### Short description
[Full length proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1z5qhuA76LYMu56dUmVt64QJxDSUYufhoUOzLhXU_FkE/edit?usp=sharing)

Statemine as the “home base” of assets in the Kusama network has so far untapped potential for users to create initial liquidity to support their project through the asset pallet and also to tokenize unique (non-fungible) assets.

This project aims to **extend the current, universal NFT explorer and marketplace interface (KodaDot) to support non-fungible tokens on Statemine.**  With the final result of this proposal, **users will be able to mint, transfer, and burn NFTs on the Statemine network**.

### Problem statement 

The current workflow **to create non-fungible assets on Statemine is not present except using extrinsics which is intended for developers’ executions and they are not end-user friendly, which result in a complex task for end-users to create NFTs.**

### Deliverables

On top of this, we will provide a **user-friendly interface to teleport KSM between Kusama and Statemine**, plus future connected parachains as well if they have close to similar functionality. The result will be, that users aren’t forced to switch between apps, chains and reload their window context completely.

First of all, our aim since every grant till today is to have [an open-source UI with permissive MIT license and support developers to fork and contribute to repository, as till today we have 60+ forks.](https://github.com/kodadot/nft-gallery/blob/main/LICENSE) 

Our primary deliverable will be an extension of KodaDot: an NFT explorer to **work with the Statemine’s unique** pallet.

**The main goal of this proposal is to provide a simple friendly NFT UI to the end-users to open flood gates to mainstream adoption of non-fungible tokens for Statemine**

**Milestone 1: Non-fungible tokens**

The first milestone is focused on the three main sections: 
- Teleport $KSM between Kusama Relay Chain and Statemine
- Implement a user interface to create, burn, transfer NFTs (and many more)
- Design and setup the SubQuery indexing service, which could be reused by other projects

**Deliverables**
- Make a page dedicated to creating a unique (NFT) with a simple workflow
- Ability to create a Class (collection)
- Show class detail with metadata
- Show minted NFTs in explorer mode
- Ability to set and remove approval for instances 
- Display metadata for particular NFT (instance)
- Transfer (send) ownership for class and instance
- Set metadata for class and instance
- Set attributes for class and instance
- Burn an instance
- Clear metadata and attributes.
- Implement a page to teleport KSM between Kusama and Statemine
- Extend vue-polkadot/api to handle multiple (parallel connections).
- Provide check if a user has enough balance on Statemine / Kusama to be able to mint and transfer a collection.
- Implement a GraphQL schema for Classes and instances
- Extend the embeddable component that will work with the Statemine implementation (note: embeddable component -> <iframe/> which would work as a page generator to show particular collections or by addresses on other existing web applications )
- Write introduction article around experience with development around unique pallet implementation
- Write introduction article presenting using KodaDot on Statemine

**Amount required -- 27_000 €**

Budget breakdown
Milestone 1 - non-fungible interface for Statemine in KodaDot
- Teleport interface for $KSM - 4k€
- Implement interface & flow 
- - Easier NFT creation - 9k€
- - Showcase & Displaying NFT assets - 6k€
- Design query and deploy SubQuery project - 8k€


### Team

The team behind [@KodaDot](https://twitter.com/kodadot)

- Matej Nemcek ([@yangwao](https://twitter.com/yangwao)) - Co-Founder of KodaDot, VueJS background, more info [hypersignal.xyz](https://hypersignal.xyz)
- Viktor Valastin ([@vikiival](https://twitter.com/vikiival)) - Co-Founder of KodaDot, [Publication about carsharing dApp on ETH using ERC721 token composition.](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/335241161_Blockchain_Based_Car-Sharing_Platform)

items.title: Proposal to fund PolkaStats operation costs for Kusama network from 01.09.2021 to 01.12.2021
items.content:
- **Proponent:** PolkaStats [GTzRQPzkcuynHgkEHhsPBFpKdh4sAacVRsnd8vYfPpTMeEY](https://kusama.polkastats.io/account/GTzRQPzkcuynHgkEHhsPBFpKdh4sAacVRsnd8vYfPpTMeEY)
- **Date**: 23-08-2021
- **Requested amount:** 2.939 KSM

Hi all,

This is a new treasury spent proposal to fund PolkaStats operation costs for Kusama network from 01.09.2021 to 01.12.2021.

### CONTEXT

[PolkaStats](https://kusama.polkastats.io/) is a Substrate block explorer aiming to provide the best staking and economic data for both validators and nominators. It helps both types of users by providing comprehensive metrics, charts and utilities to improve their knowledge and performance.

PolkaStats is one of the projects that was born in La Colmena, a crypto community based in Sevilla, southern Spain. The community aims to incentivize content-creation in Spanish for Polkadot, Kusama and other blockchain projects and, as supporters of open source culture, develop software to contribute to the ecosystem. The organization also acts like an incubator that helped create blockchain business models like DragonStake or Delega Networks validators.

Although there are currently already some very good Substrate explorers in the ecosystem, PolkaStats has a different perspective to offer in order to increase diversity among the existing solutions. PolkaStats differentiates from other explorers in:

- Focusing on Proof of Stake chains only.
- Being a full Javascript based block explorer (both frontend and backend)
- Utilising Vue.js, Nuxt.js and GraphQL with a soft learning curve.

### SPENDING PROPOSAL

PolkaStats aims to submit a spending proposal to the Kusama Treasury on the following terms:

- A 3 month period pre-paid funding for operational expenses, which totals to 2.939 KSM for the period 01.09.2021 - 01.12.2021.
- KSM base-price is determined using EMA30 price from Subscan: $264.574 (225.60 €)
- The funds are used to pay the servers we rent to Hetzer and Digital Ocean in order to operate PolkaStats for the Kusama network.

### MONTHLY BUDGET

Please find below a detailed budget of PolkaStats monthly operational costs for Kusama network:

- Hetzner AX61-NVMe (KUSAMA): 99.96 €
- Hetzner AX61-NVMe (DEVELOPMENT): 99.96 €
- ½ Digital Ocean 4 vCPUs 8GB / 160GB Disk (DEVELOPMENT): 16.92 €
- ½ Digital Ocean 1 vCPUs 2GB / 50GB Disk (MONITORING): 4.23 €
- TOTAL: 221.07 € / Month
- TOTAL KSM (1 KSM = 225.60 €): 0.979 KSM / Month

NOTE: Conversion rate of 1 KSM = $264.5745 = 225.60 € was calculated using [EMA30 price](https://kusama.subscan.io/tools/price_converter?value=1&type=block&from=KSM&to=USD&time=0) from Subscan at 23/08/2021

### PREVIOUS APPROVED PROPOSALS

Proposal I:

- Period: 17.09.2020 - 17.12.2021
- Document: [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1eJIyyyl2Asr8tX05zpO-sUOa2aSoeIlCGag030t0vrA](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1eJIyyyl2Asr8tX05zpO-sUOa2aSoeIlCGag030t0vrA) 
- Discussion: [https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/290](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/290) 
- Executed at block #4,086,175 (2020-09-17 11:37:36)
- Treasury proposal: [https://kusama.polkassembly.io/treasury/47](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/treasury/47) 
- Motion: [https://kusama.polkassembly.io/motion/214 ](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/motion/214 )

Proposal II:

- Period: 17.12.2020 - 17.03.2021
- Discussion: [https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/480](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/480) 
- Executed at block #6,091,572 (2021-02-06 09:32:12)
- Treasury proposal: [https://kusama.polkassembly.io/treasury/77](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/treasury/77) 
- Motion: [https://kusama.polkassembly.io/motion/268](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/motion/268)  

### SOME KUSAMA METRICS

Google Analytics metrics of the Kusama version of PolkaStats in the last month:

- 1822 unique users
